=Hey {{ $json.result.personFullName.split(" ").first() }},

I know you're hiring right now‚Äîjust wanted to tell you I'm the right fit for the job. To be upfront: I actually used AI to scrape this job, customize my resume, and then automatically get your contact details. 

I know showing is better than telling, so would be happy to run you/any hiring managers here through the system. If picked, I'd going far above and beyond the job description (and implement systems similar to this in {{ $('Limit').item.json.companyName }}).

Resume below. Let me know what you'd like to do next!

https://docs.google.com/document/d/{{ $('Create New Resume').item.json.id }}

Thanks,
Nick

json.title: VP Data & Analytics
json.descriptionHtml:
üöÄ Vice President of Data & Analytics


Location: Hybrid (Primarily Remote with Occasional Travel)

Department: Data & Analytics

Seniority Level: Executive

Are you a visionary data leader ready to shape the future of a fast-growing consumer brand? We‚Äôre looking for a Vice President of Data & Analytics to drive enterprise-wide data strategy, modernize infrastructure, and turn insights into business acceleration. This is a high-impact leadership role where your work will directly influence company-wide decisions, innovation, and scalable growth.


üîç What You'll Do

  • Define and lead a company-wide data strategy aligned with long-term business goals
  • Build and scale modern data infrastructure, cloud platforms, and data pipelines
  • Lead teams across data engineering, analytics, and data science
  • Champion a data-driven culture by enabling self-service BI, intuitive dashboards, and trusted data access
  • Develop predictive models, ML/AI-driven insights, and decision support systems
  • Ensure data governance, quality, and compliance with regulatory standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
  • Collaborate with executive leadership to translate business priorities into data-powered initiatives
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and lead best practices in architecture and tooling
  • Drive real-time analytics and automation across core business workflows


üß† What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • 10+ years in data engineering, data science, or analytics, including 5+ in a leadership role
  • Proven success building and scaling high-performing data teams and platforms
  • Deep expertise in SQL, data modeling, cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), and ETL/ELT
  • Strong background with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Omni
  • Solid understanding of AI/ML concepts and how to apply them in real-world business contexts
  • Exceptional communication and storytelling skills for executive and cross-functional collaboration
  • Business acumen in eCommerce, manufacturing, or consumer products strongly preferred


üí° Why This Role

  • Executive visibility and strategic influence
  • High-growth, data-forward culture with strong investment in modern technology
  • Opportunity to shape the future of how data powers products, operations, and customer experience
  • Flexible hybrid work environment


Interested in driving data transformation from the top down? Let‚Äôs talk.

Apply now to explore this opportunity to lead data into the next chapter of innovation.

json.companyDescription:
Harnham provides specialist Data and AI recruitment and staffing services, along with bespoke training solutions, across multiple industry verticals, operating in the UK, the USA and EU - contact us today to discuss your requirements: info@harnham.com 

Our recruitment and talent teams cover all aspects of the data and AI pipeline, from collection to consumption, across multiple data roles and functions. 

Whether you need full-time staff, contract talent, specialized training, Data-qualified graduates, or C-suite executives, Harnham Group is equipped to fulfill all your data talent requirements.

Our five core services:

* ATD - Rockborne ‚Äì our graduate development arm ‚Äì deploys expertly trained data consultants, who have gone through an intensive 12-week data training programme. After two years in the scheme, your consultant could become a 

* Contract / C2C / Freelance: Whether you're addressing a talent shortage, augmenting a project team, or encountering resource gaps, our specialist consultants offer bespoke interim talent solutions to address your unique challenges and drive success.

* Full-Time / Direct Hiring: From early career professionals to senior management, our comprehensive services enable you to unearth outstanding data talent across various specializations, ensuring your organization thrives in the data-driven era.

* Executive Search: With our dedicated executive search team and an extensive network encompassing the director to C-suite level, we assist both global corporations and ambitious startups in securing top-tier leadership talent to accomplish their goals.

* GenAI, Prompt, LLM Training: Elevate your team's data expertise with our all-encompassing training programs covering essential tools and technologies such as Python, SQL, Machine Learning, LLM‚Äôs and AI. Highly bespoke, customised to your team learning requirements and budgets.
json.companySlogan: Harnham is the global leader in Data and AI talent solutions.

json.title: AI Product Manager / AI Business Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
Aventis Solutions is partnering with multiple high-impact AI innovation teams that are actively hiring Product Owners, Product Managers, and AI Business Analysts (AI Analysts / Artificial Intelligence Analysts) with a strong business mindset, a user-first approach, and a passion for emerging AI technologies. These roles are ideal for commercially driven individuals who want to work at the forefront of applied AI, without requiring a deep technical background.


Key Details:


  • Salary Bracket: $110,000‚Äì$190,000 base + up to 20% bonuses + 401(k) match + generous PTO + top-tier health benefits
  • Location: Remote-first with tech hubs in New York City, Austin, Chicago, and Miami.
  • Career Outlook: Pathways to Senior PM, AI Product Strategist, Delivery Managers or Chief of Staff roles within AI innovation labs or platform teams. Ideal for those eager to grow into leadership while staying close to the pulse of emerging AI.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


  • Business-Minded Problem Solver: You bring structure to ambiguity, love solving messy real-world problems, and think in terms of ROI, outcomes, and customer experience.
  • AI-Curious, Not Necessarily Technical: You don‚Äôt need to code, but you have a working knowledge of what LLMs, vector databases, and intelligent automation can do, and you‚Äôre eager to learn more.
  • User-First Thinker: You instinctively seek out user pain points and know how to translate them into product requirements and design briefs.
  • Cross-Functional Collaborator: You‚Äôre great at working with engineers, data scientists, and designers, translating business needs into technical scope (and vice versa).
  • Agile & Lean Fluent: Experience with agile product development, sprint planning, backlog grooming, and rapid MVP testing.
  • Excellent Communicator: Comfortable creating product briefs, competitive analyses, stakeholder decks, and clear documentation.
  • Bonus Experience: Background in fintech, healthtech, insurance, asset management, enterprise SaaS, or regulated industries (but not required). Familiarity with tools like Jira, Notion, Figma, and Confluence.


What You‚Äôll Do:


Join AI-focused product squads working across use cases like intelligent search, AI copilots, enterprise automation, and LLM-powered platforms. You‚Äôll be a bridge between business goals and technical teams, helping shape product roadmaps, gathering user requirements, validating ideas quickly, and defining success metrics.


Whether the team is building internal tooling, launching a customer-facing product, or experimenting with generative AI features, you‚Äôll play a key role in defining what gets built and why.




Interested? Please apply with your CV or message Billy Hall for further details.












Aventis is working on behalf of its partner.

json.title: Senior Data Scientist (US Based Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
About Torus

Torus is a pioneering, sustainable energy solutions company based in Utah, dedicated to revolutionizing renewable energy storage and management. Our mission is to empower communities to become their own sustainable energy providers.

We are driven by a deep-rooted commitment to sustainability and community. We tackle critical challenges facing the American energy landscape. Our advanced Torus Spin Flywheel‚Ñ¢ technology charges and discharges electricity 16 times faster than traditional batteries, ensuring rapid response to grid demands and enhancing energy efficiency.

Our advanced manufacturing, research, and development facilities in South Salt Lake and Springville, Utah drive continuous innovation, and our commitment to American manufacturing ensures quality and reliability. Join us at Torus and be part of an exciting team that is transforming the energy landscape.

About The Role

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist to lead our AI/ML initiatives and drive innovation in renewable energy solutions through advanced machine learning, anomaly detection, reinforcement learning, and intelligent automation systems. The ideal candidate is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation in renewable energy solutions and create a seamless user experience for our customers.

The Role and Data @ Torus

As a Senior Data Scientist at Torus, you'll spearhead our advanced AI/ML strategy. We operate with a "full-stack data practitioner" philosophy and have a modern data stack (dbt, Redshift, Airflow, Fivetran, Metabase, and Streamlit). You'll architect and implement AI systems including reinforcement learning frameworks, anomaly detection pipelines, intelligent automation systems, and selective LLM integrations.

In this role, you'll help drive the strategic vision for how advanced AI (in all of its flavors!) transforms our mission. You'll lead the development of sophisticated ML systems that process diverse energy datasets, create autonomous decision-making frameworks through reinforcement learning, and deploy real-time anomaly detection systems that ensure grid reliability and optimize system performance. Your work will directly influence product strategy and guide team members in implementing best practices for production AI systems.

Our products operate within complex ecosystems including IoT, the electrical grid, commercial and industrial buildings, and smart home devices. Your expertise will help us leverage these ecosystems and all relevant public data to proactively identify inefficiencies, equipment failures, and grid disturbances before they impact customers.

Who You Are

  • Action-oriented: You're proactive and find solutions to existing problems. You lean toward experimentation and rapid prototyping over endless planning.
  • AI/ML innovator: You stay at the forefront of AI research and excel at translating breakthrough techniques into production systems.
  • Naturally curious: You're eager to explore emerging technologies and find novel applications in the energy domain.
  • Adaptable: You thrive in a startup environment that demands autonomy, speed, and comfort with ambiguity.
  • Mission-driven: You're passionate about using data to combat climate change and transform how people consume energy.
  • Team-focused: You work well as part of a collaborative data team with full-stack data practitioners.
  • Self-starter: You're excited to work in a rapidly growing startup and apply your technical skills to help customers live clean, renewable lives.

What You'll Own

Full-Stack Data Practitioner

  • Discover, ingest, and leverage available datasets to inform strategic decisions
  • Develop robust data pipelines to collect, clean, analyze, and manage critical business data
  • Apply a range of analytical approaches‚Äîfrom descriptive analytics to advanced machine learning (ML or DL)‚Äîto solve complex energy optimization problems
  • Provide expert analysis of large, complex, and unique data sets from IoT devices at scale
  • Build and implement predictive models that drive product intelligence and business strategy
  • Move data science out of notebooks and into production to deliver real value to customers
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate data insights into actionable recommendations

Advanced ML/DL

  • Lead the design and implementation of autonomous decision-making systems for energy optimization and system performance
  • Architect real-time anomaly detection pipelines for IoT sensor networks, equipment monitoring, and grid stability
  • Build sophisticated anomaly detection models for early identification of equipment failures, grid disturbances, and energy inefficiencies
  • Create simulation environments for testing and validating RL policies before production deployment
  • Establish best practices for responsible AI development, including model governance, bias detection, and explainability frameworks

Required Experience

  • Typically requires a graduate degree in Data Science or a related field and 5‚Äì7+ years of experience, but we value diverse learning paths and welcome candidates who demonstrate equivalent expertise.
  • Expert SQL skills with extensive experience working with relational databases and non-relational databases
  • Expert data science programming skills in Python
  • Experience with big data platforms such as Redshift, Athena, etc
  • Experience with, or willingness to learn, our modern data stack: dbt, Airflow, Fivetran, and Streamlit
  • Familiarity with cloud computing (AWS)
  • Production experience with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.) and specialized experience in reinforcement learning libraries (Stable-Baselines3, Ray RLlib, OpenAI Gym, etc.)
  • Hands-on experience designing and deploying anomaly detection systems for time series and multivariate sensor data
  • Experience with unsupervised learning techniques for anomaly detection (autoencoders, isolation forests, one-class SVM, statistical methods)
  • Experience deploying ML models in production environments with proper monitoring, versioning, and rollback capabilities
  • Hands-on experience with model serving frameworks for real-time inference (TensorFlow Serving, TorchServe, FastAPI) and streaming data processing

Preferred Experience

  • Knowledge of distributed systems, edge computing, or federated learning for IoT applications
  • Experience with multi-agent reinforcement learning and coordinated autonomous systems
  • Knowledge of advanced anomaly detection techniques including deep anomaly detection and self-supervised approaches
  • Experience applying RL and anomaly detection to IoT time series data, sensor fusion, and industrial control systems
  • Experience with predictive maintenance, equipment monitoring, or industrial anomaly detection systems
  • Experience with causal inference, counterfactual reasoning, and explainable AI for critical systems
  • Familiarity with AI safety practices, robustness testing, and responsible deployment of autonomous systems
  • Knowledge of LLMs and RAG systems with practical experience in selective integration where beneficial
  • Experience integrating LLMs and RAG systems for specialized technical applications

Our Perks & Benefits

  • Employee Rewards Package including equity
  • 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
  • Health Benefits Package: Choice between traditional PPO or HSA eligible medical plans; Dental insurance; and Vision insurance
  • Human-centered Paid Time Off (based on employment status) including unlimited discretionary PTO or 10 days accrued PTO; 10-days paid company holidays; Waiting period-free 100% paid parental leave.
  • Torus paid Life with option to purchase additional coverage
  • Voluntary Short- and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Peer Recognition Program

Additional Details

Background Check All candidates are subject to a background check.

Experience Typically requires a graduate degree in Data Science or a related field and 5‚Äì7+ years of experience, but we value diverse learning paths and welcome candidates who demonstrate equivalent expertise.

Location + Travel The role is remote based in the US. Requires occasional travel to our South Salt Lake Headquarters.

Schedule Full-Time, Salaried

Compensation $140,000 - 170,000 (Note: We have the flexibility to hire at different levels, which may impact the corresponding pay range.)

Work Authorization Applicants must already have the legal authorization to work in the US without requiring any employer sponsorship.

Physical Requirements

  • Constantly operates a computer and other peripheral office equipment such as a printer or mouse.
  • Ability to communicate information so others can understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.
  • Must report to work reliably and with the ability to use full and unimpaired skills and judgment to safely execute your job.
  • Proficiency in reading, writing, and speaking English required.

Torus is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

json.title: Vice President of AI
json.descriptionHtml:
Teladoc Health is a global, whole person care company made up of a diverse community of people dedicated to transforming the healthcare experience. As an employee, you‚Äôre empowered to show up every day as your most authentic self and be a part of something bigger ‚Äì thriving both personally and professionally. Together, let‚Äôs empower people everywhere to live their healthiest lives.

Summary Of Position

Teladoc Health is a global leader in virtual healthcare, providing innovative solutions that enable individuals to access high-quality medical care and support remotely. Our mission is to improve the health and well-being of people everywhere by transforming the healthcare experience. Join our dynamic team and help shape the future of healthcare!

We are seeking an experienced and forward-thinking Vice President of AI to lead and scale our platform infrastructure, ensuring it meets the demands of a growing global user base. This leader will drive the vision, strategy, and execution of technology solutions that provide scalable, reliable, and high-performance systems. The Vice President of AI will collaborate across teams, from product to operations, and partner with other senior leaders to build robust systems that support Teladoc's growth and innovation.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

  • Lead and scale a high-performing team of engineers and researchers dedicated to developing, operationalizing, and optimizing AI, including robust infrastructure, and scalable AI systems.
  • Define, evangelize, and execute the strategic vision, roadmap, and objectives for AI Engineering, Responsible AI governance, and AI-driven product innovation, aligning closely with Teladoc's broader business and innovation strategies.
  • Oversee and drive the architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance optimization of Teladoc‚Äôs AI technology platforms, encompassing cloud infrastructure, data and ML/AI pipelines, model deployment, monitoring frameworks, and backend integrations.
  • Lead initiatives in Generative AI (GenAI), leveraging state-of-the-art models and techniques to drive new product capabilities, personalization, and intelligent automation across the Teladoc ecosystem.
  • Establish and operate a cutting-edge AI Lab focused on research and development, experimentation, rapid prototyping, and technology incubation to accelerate innovation and advance Teladoc‚Äôs position as a digital health leader.
  • Lead Responsible AI practices, ensuring compliance, ethical considerations, fairness, transparency, and explainability across all AI initiatives, driving organizational maturity and best practices.
  • Actively evangelize AI-driven transformation internally and externally, driving widespread adoption of AI products, promoting a data-driven culture, and orchestrating Teladoc‚Äôs ascent on the AI maturity curve.
  • Recruit, mentor, and retain exceptional AI talent, cultivating a culture of innovation, continuous learning, technical rigor, and collaboration.
  • Collaborate closely with senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Security, Clinical, Business Operations) to ensure alignment and integration of AI strategies with organizational goals.
  • Continuously evaluate emerging industry trends and novel AI technologies, positioning Teladoc at the forefront of AI and digital health innovation, while influencing strategic decisions to capture future market opportunities.
  • Drive optimization and operational efficiency across AI lifecycle management, resource allocation, infrastructure scalability, and project execution timelines.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Yes

Qualifications Expected For Position

  • PhD preferred in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or related quantitative fields; Master's degree required at a minimum.
  • 10+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, software development, or related fields, including 5+ years in senior leadership roles directly managing large-scale engineering and AI teams.
  • Proven track record of delivering AI-driven products and platforms, demonstrating measurable business impact and successful scaling of AI operations.
  • Deep technical expertise in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), ML/AI frameworks, and modern software engineering best practices (CI/CD, agile development, DevOps).
  • Strong understanding of AI model lifecycle management, responsible AI frameworks, regulatory compliance, and ethical standards.
  • Excellent communication, strategic leadership, and stakeholder management skills, with proven ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights and strategies for diverse audiences.
  • Demonstrated experience successfully evangelizing and driving organizational adoption of AI and advanced technologies.
  • Industry experience in healthcare, digital health, telemedicine, or related sectors highly desirable.
  • Strategic thinker with deep technical acumen, business intuition, and a proactive mindset in rapidly evolving technological environments.

The base salary range for this position is $250,000 - $350,000. In addition to a base salary, this position is eligible for a performance bonus and benefits (subject to eligibility requirements) listed here: Teladoc Health Benefits 2025. Total compensation is based on several factors including, but not limited to, type of position, location, education level, work experience, and certifications. This information is applicable for all full-time positions.

Teladoc Health will not sponsor or transfer employment work visas for this position. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Why Join Teladoc Health?

A New Category in Healthcare: ‚ÄØTeladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives. ‚ÄØ

Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person‚Äôs health journey. ‚ÄØ

Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals. ‚ÄØ

Focus on PEOPLE:‚ÄØ Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer‚ÄØby numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment.‚ÄØ

Diversity and Inclusion:‚ÄØ‚ÄØAt Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Growth and Innovation:‚ÄØ We‚Äôve already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members.‚ÄØ

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy.

Teladoc Health respects your privacy and is committed to maintaining the confidentiality and security of your personal information. In furtherance of your employment relationship with Teladoc Health, we collect personal information responsibly and in accordance with applicable data privacy laws, including but not limited to, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Personal information is defined as: Any information or set of information relating to you, including (a) all information that identifies you or could reasonably be used to identify you, and (b) all information that any applicable law treats as personal information. Teladoc Health‚Äôs Notice of Privacy Practices for U.S. Employees‚Äô Personal information is available at this link.

json.title: AI Transformation Principal
json.descriptionHtml:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity ‚Äì human or machine ‚Äì across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world‚Äôs leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on X, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

CyberArk is looking for a team of AI Transformation Principals to drive function-specific design, engagement, and execution of a wider CyberArk transformation program aimed at transforming how we work using AI, automation, and data. You will bring your unique blend of deep functional and operational understanding, strategic design thinking, business acumen, and expertise in applying and operationalizing the use of AI, automation, and data to realize the scaled use of these technologies to achieve our strategic, financial, and operational objectives. As a focal point for the business function, you will lead and partner and with colleagues from all levels within the function and across CyberArk, including senior leaders and SMEs. You will work directly with the Director of Strategic Initiatives, AI Transformation team, and other stakeholders including IT, business process owners, and operations while gaining exposure to the Executive Leadership Team and the wider transformation initiative across CyberArk

Responsibilities:


  • Develop a deep understanding of CyberArk‚Äôs and their focus business functions‚Äô (one or more of the following: HR, Legal, Finance, IT, B2B Software Product Development, Go-To-Market (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Solutions)) operating contexts, goals, and strategies (Note: Principals will be assigned to specific functional areas based on background expertise)
  • Baseline the focus business functions‚Äô current state of AI/automation/data maturity and capabilities
  • Work with senior leaders, functional SMEs, and team members including IT and operations, to frame, structure, and execute on the AI/automation/data transformation of their focus business function(s) as part of the overall transformation of CyberArk
  • Define, iterate, and execute on the functional transformation roadmap and priorities
  • Infuse external best practices and methodologies for adopting AI/automation/data into their focus business functions, while adapting these best practices with a ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs best for CyberArk‚Äù approach
  • Drive wide-spread adoption of AI and automation within their focus business function(s), including support for ongoing user engagement and enablement, and providing technical guidance on potential implementation pathways
  • Conduct analyses and develop insights/recommendations and action plans
  • Establish operating rhythm to guide initiative governance, success metrics, and tracking
  • Maintain strong focus on implementation and change management to ensure strategies are successfully translated into execution
  • Identify initiative dependencies and risks and develop mitigation plans
  • Build executive presentations to share insights/implications, provide progress updates, and escalate critical items


Qualifications


  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree and 7+ years of professional experience
  • Experience leading AI/automation/data transformation initiatives in one or more of the following business functions: HR, Legal, Finance, IT, B2B Software Product
  • Development, Go-To-Market (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Solutions), preferably in the context of high-growth B2B software organization, to drive measurable impact to business performance and customer experience
  • Experience in business process mapping and redesign of their focus business function, with a strong focus on pragmatic integration of AI/automation/data
  • Knowledgeable in the ‚Äòart-of-the-possible‚Äô for AI/automation/data with a pragmatic understanding of the technologies‚Äô risks and shortcomings
  • Energized by ambiguity and solving complex problems via left and right brain thinking
  • Skilled in strategic program/project management
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to drive ‚Äúdrumbeat‚Äù to move initiatives forward
  • Ability to build relationships and inspire/influence/motivate/coach colleagues at all levels
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills across all levels of the organization
  • Experience with change management frameworks and internal communications
  • Experience working with and translating between deeply technical and non-technical teams
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment
  • Smart, bold but humble attitude to work collaboratively with fellow CyberArkers


Job Specifications:


  • Hybrid (3 days a week) with office locations in Newton, MA or Petah Tikva, Israel


Additional Information

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

The salary range for this position is $185,000 ‚Äì $200,000/year, plus commissions or discretionary bonus, which will be based on the employee‚Äôs performance. Base pay may also vary considerably depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The compensation package includes a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

json.companyDescription:
CyberArk is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity ‚Äì human or machine ‚Äì across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads, and the DevOps lifecycle. The world‚Äôs leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. 

For over 25 years, CyberArk has led the market in securing enterprises against cyber attacks that take cover behind insider privileges and attack critical enterprise assets. Today, only CyberArk delivers a new category of targeted security solutions that help leaders stop reacting to cyber threats and get ahead of them, preventing attack escalation before irreparable business harm is done. At a time when auditors and regulators recognize that privileged accounts are the fast track for cyber attacks and demand stronger protection, CyberArk‚Äôs security solutions master high-stakes compliance and audit requirements while arming businesses to protect what matters most.
json.companySlogan: CyberArk is the global leader in identity security.

json.title: Machine Learning Engineer
json.descriptionHtml:
MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER

Salary Range: $150k to $175k


We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing AI/ML team focused on transforming healthcare delivery. The ideal candidate has a strong background in deploying and managing scalable machine learning solutions, with specific experience in healthcare data and systems. You‚Äôll play a key role in leading engineering efforts, designing ML/GenAI architectures, and implementing robust deployment frameworks that align with business strategy.


Key Responsibilities

  • Model Engineering & Deployment: Build and maintain production-grade ML models with an emphasis on real-time inference, scalability, and reliability.
  • End-to-End ML Infrastructure: Design and implement scalable ML pipelines on AWS, GCP, or Azure.
  • AI/GenAI Strategy: Lead development of advanced LLM and RAG frameworks; drive innovation in ML/GenAI integration strategies.
  • Healthcare Integration: Work with EHR systems to embed ML models into clinical workflows, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with data scientists, data engineers, DevOps, and business stakeholders to continuously improve AI performance.
  • CI/CD Optimization: Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for ML using tools such as GitHub Actions.
  • Monitoring & Logging: Set up and manage tools to monitor system health and ML model performance.
  • Security & Compliance: Ensure ML systems meet HIPAA and other data privacy regulations.
  • Version Control & Documentation: Implement best practices for version control and document all model configurations and deployment processes.


Qualifications

Required:

  • 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Informatics, or related field.
  • Strong knowledge of predictive modeling, NLP, and LLMs, including the use of the RAG framework.
  • Hands-on experience with Terraform for infrastructure automation.
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL, and either R or a comparable language.
  • Deep understanding of architecture, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and deployment strategies.
  • Proven experience building scalable, secure, and compliant AI/ML systems.
  • Expertise in CI/CD automation and DevOps collaboration.

Preferred:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.
  • Experience working with Electronic Health Records (EHR) systems.
  • Certifications in machine learning or cloud computing.
  • Experience with monitoring tools and logging frameworks.

json.jobPosterTitle: Technical Recruiter at Prosum | Tech Recruiting, Talent Acquisition, Recruitment Strategy
json.industries: Information Services, Technology, Information and Media, and Hospitals and Health Care
json.companyDescription:
Prosum is an award-winning Staffing Solutions provider specializing in Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Permanent placements in the Information Technology industry. 

Our seasoned recruitment team brings a unique approach to your staffing needs. In addition to our keen understanding of local market needs, we employ a distinctively personal interview process. We take the time to get to know each candidate, including their expertise, training, goals and individual personality. 

This human approach allows us to be more flexible, more attentive and, most importantly, to do the right thing. It also means we empower our experts to go beyond cookie-cutter solutions in favor of a tailor-made staff augmentation plan.

And that means we‚Äôre more likely to find candidates who will thrive in your organization. 

We are the link that gets you from where you are now, to where you want to be and beyond.

json.title: VP of AI Technology / CTO
json.descriptionHtml:
Aventis Solutions is proud to partner with a transformative technology firm operating at the intersection of finance, healthcare, and real estate to reignite their CITO: technology and software engineering division. We are now leading the search for a Head / Vice President of AI Technology (VP of AI) to architect, scale, and operationalize AI infrastructure and engineering capabilities across the enterprise.


Key Details:


Salary: $250,000‚Äì$280,000 + bonuses + private healthcare + long-term equity incentives

Location: New York HQ + remote working

Leadership Scope: Reporting into the CIO, you will serve as the executive lead for AI engineering and technical enablement, managing senior-level engineers with significant support and financial backing to scale quickly.


Key Skills, Attributes, and Technologies Desired:


  • AI Engineering Leadership: Proven success in leading the development and deployment of data engineering, software engineering or more advanced AI/ML development at scale, from prototype to production, across cloud-native environments.
  • Commercial Acumen: Strong understanding of how AI and data-driven technologies create business value. Able to align technical solutions with P&L impact, product-market fit, and customer success metrics.
  • ML Infrastructure & Ops: Deep understanding of machine learning infrastructure, including MLOps, model lifecycle automation, and scalable model deployment frameworks.
  • Advanced Modelling & Data Science: Understanding and/or technical capability with advanced ML techniques (deep learning, NLP, forecasting, optimisation), plus Python-based ML stacks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn).
  • Data Platform Engineering: Familiarity with real-time data pipelines and modern data architecture, including Microsoft Azure, Fabric, Spark and Databricks. Experience designing AI-ready data ecosystems and versioned feature stores is a strong plus.
  • Cloud-Native AI Architecture: Strong technical experience building scalable systems using cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure). Preference for hybrid and distributed deployments using containers (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform).
  • Generative AI Applications: Working knowledge of large language models (LLMs) and GenAI frameworks (e.g. LangChain, OpenAI, Claude, etc.). Experience applying generative models to real-world use cases like document parsing, workflow automation, or predictive chat interfaces.
  • AI & Data Governance & Risk Management: Comfort with establishing engineering guardrails for responsible AI, ensuring model interpretability, compliance (e.g. GDPR, HIPAA), and alignment with ethical standards.
  • Cross-Sector Innovation: Exposure to complex industries such as finance, healthcare, or real estate, where AI is used to power decisions, automate operations, or personalise experiences.
  • Technical Communication & Team Building: Ability to communicate engineering decisions to senior stakeholders. You foster a culture of experimentation, delivery excellence, and talent development across high-performing teams.



Role Overview:


As the company‚Äôs first VP of AI Technology, you will be the technical architect behind the organisation‚Äôs AI-powered transformation. With direct influence on engineering strategy and product design, you‚Äôll ensure that AI becomes a fully integrated capability across operations and services. If you're ready to take a leading role in building enterprise AI capabilities from the ground up, this is your moment. Drive innovation at scale with a mission-driven, cross-sector tech firm that's investing in long-term AI success. We'd consider a wide range of backgrounds, such as a Head of Software Engineering, Chief Technology Officer, Staff Software Engineer, Head of Data Science, CDO, CTO, CIO or similar.




Interested? Please apply with your CV or message Billy Hall for further details.












Aventis is working on behalf of its partner.

json.title: QA Lead (AI/ML Testing)
json.descriptionHtml:
PAY: $70-80/hour W2. Our company offers our consultants a suite of benefits after a qualification period including health, vision, dental, life and disability insurance.

100% remote role, no expectation of onsite work

W2 Candidates only

6+ month contract role

Manager Notes

  • This role will be a blend of Manual & Automated Testing - being able to Automate the possible. The team uses Playwright, similar to Selenium. Python + PyTest, Jest Testing. Open to other toolsets.
  • Seeking someone that can Lead / strategize for QA Testing vs simply execution.
  • Role will develop comprehensive Testing strategy. Some knowledge/experience with GenAi ideal Open to functions that involves creativity around Testing methods. Legal/HR potentially mentioned as interesting domains, involving sensitive, protected datasets.
  • Formulating the approach as well as execution, dive into code, as a true QA expert would be ideal.
  • From a Risk / GenAI perspective, understanding Bias Checking of the GenAi tool

Description:

  • As the QA lead for LLM testing, will define and execute the technical vision and strategy for AI controls and testing.
  • Responsibilities will include continuous monitoring, evaluation, and reporting of LLM features to ensure compliance with internal standards, best practices, and external regulations.
  • Play a key role in risk assessment and mitigation, guiding the responsible development and deployment of LLMs.
  • Will design and implement test cases for LLM governance and development, enabling your team to define features and mitigate risks.
  • Develop tools, automation strategies, and data pipelines to support scalable LLM management.
  • Create standardized reporting templates for both technical and senior leadership audiences, ensuring clear communication of results.
  • Work will involve close collaboration with tool owners and senior management to present findings, assess risk implications, and propose enhancements to AI tools.

Responsibilities

  • Lead QA efforts for the platform, focusing on LLM output testing to ensure reliability, accuracy, and performance
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive testing strategies, including semantic similarity, Q&A validation, claims verification, LLM judge evaluations, and metrics like ROUGE
  • Collaborate with engineering, product, and data science teams to define testing requirements, thresholds, and standards
  • Design and implement robust test cases aligned with business goals and user needs
  • Write and maintain automated tests in Python using frameworks like pytest (prior experience with Opik is not required)
  • Monitor and improve test stability to support application changes
  • Establish and track QA KPIs, such as test coverage and stability, to measure and communicate platform quality
  • Stay updated on industry best practices for GenAI/LLM testing and integrate them into QA processes

Qualifications

  • Strong experience in writing and maintaining Python code
  • Familiarity with testing LLM outputs, including semantic similarity, Q&A validation, claims verification, LLM judges, and evaluation metrics like ROUGE
  • Experience with automated testing tools (e.g., pytest); willingness to learn Opik if unfamiliar
  • Proven ability to design and implement test strategies for complex systems

Who We Are:

The Fountain Group is a nationwide staffing firm with over 80 Fortune 100-500 clients. Since 2001, TFG has maintained a consistent standard of excellence, and our work is broadly recognized every year through numerous industry performance awards. Our success is a team effort.

Browse our website below for additional information on our company.

The Fountain Group

3407 W Martin Luther King Jr. Dr. Tampa, FL 33607

‚ÄúWe work in Life Sciences, Clinical, Engineering, IT, and more. Above all, we specialize in people.‚Äù

json.companyDescription:
The Fountain Group provides Contingent Labor, Statement-of-Work, and Contingent-to-Permanent resources to clients with an internal/external Contingent Labor Managed Service Program or Clients without a program.

The Fountain Group is committed to the belief that we all share in the responsibility to conduct our businesses in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. We base this on the premise that a company is much more than the products it offers. The effect a company has on the environment, the people and the communities it serves reflects the company‚Äôs dedication to being not only a good business, but to being a good corporate citizen. 

The Fountain Group believes the key to servicing a client is to identify the client demand precisely. Therefore, The Fountain Group focused its efforts on building and developing a process, which can identify an exact match for our client‚Äôs needs. Our process utilizes modern technology combined with 30+ years of Talent Acquisition experience to deliver Precision resources.

Financial strength is prominent among The Fountain Group‚Äôs corporate values. The future of our business will be built on the innovation, compassion, outstanding services and technology, but a solid financial foundation is required to carry us forward to meet our business goal and support our long term vision.
json.companySlogan: Your Ally in the Quest for Workforce Success

json.title: Director, AI Solutions
json.descriptionHtml:
The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Director of AI Solutions to join the fast-evolving Polaris IQ and Technology teams at Wpromote. In this role, you‚Äôll report into the VP of AI and drive the development and deployment of AI-powered operational efficiencies and AI-driven product features with a high degree of autonomy operating in an individual contributor role. You‚Äôll be responsible for delivering AI agents and prompt engineering that unlocks productivity, enhances decision-making, and elevates the intelligence layer of our proprietary platform. This position blends deep hands-on experience with AI toolchains and a strategic mindset that informs product design, user experience, and technical partnerships. You'll work cross-functionally across product, engineering, and data strategy to shape the future of intelligent automation at Wpromote.

At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in marketing.

We offer:


  • Remote-first culture
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Extended Holiday break (Winter)
  • Flexible schedules
  • Work from anywhere options*
  • 100% paid parental leave
  • 401(k) matching
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
  • Sponsored life insurance
  • Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
  • Annual Class Pass credits and more!



The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $135,000 - $175,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state‚Äôs salary threshold for exempt employees. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above) and an annual performance bonus.

This role has an associated annual target bonus component which is paid out based on a number of factors which include Company performance, department performance, and individual performance. Bonuses are not guaranteed and you must be an active employee in good standing and not on a Performance Improvement Plan to be eligible for the annual bonus.


  • This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions
  • While this role offers the flexibility to work remotely, we have office hubs in Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York, where you can join in on learning and development opportunities, fun events, take advantage of a space to work, and collaborate in person!
  • This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship



Important Notice: Beware of Job Scams

Wpromote recruiting communications will only be sent through our official channels via wpromote.com email addresses. If you see a posting elsewhere that is not reflected on Wpromote.com/careers, it may be a fraudulent posting. We do not require payment or fees during the hiring process nor do we request sensitive information, such as Social Security numbers or payment details. Please safeguard yourself against possible scams and contact us if you encounter any suspicious activity.

You Will Be


  • Designing and implementing low- and no-code AI solutions aligned to internal automation needs and Polaris IQ product roadmap initiatives
  • Building AI agents to represent clients, marketing data, marketing intelligence applications, and roles within the business
  • Building AI architecture to allow agents to collaborate to solve problems and curate responses dynamically
  • Lead prompt engineer for all use cases and workflows in the agency
  • Overseeing prompt engineering and quality assurance for Polaris IQ‚Äôs AI agent workflows, ensuring outputs remain accurate, aligned with business objectives, and adaptive to evolving context
  • Collaborating with Engineering on agent orchestration, context management, and scalable system design
  • Partnering with internal product and operations stakeholders to map opportunities and convert them into ROI-positive deployable AI capabilities
  • Acting as a subject matter expert for the organization on intelligent workflows, reinforcing best practices in prompt design, prompt chaining, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
  • Supporting UX and frontend teams in designing intuitive user interactions that unlock agent utility without requiring technical fluency
  • Contributing to data pipeline and tooling conversations, ensuring prompt context and feedback loops are powered by trustworthy data sources
  • Managing multiple initiatives simultaneously, balancing experimentation with scalable deployment to meet roadmap goals



You Must Have


  • 4+ years of experience in strategy, innovation, or technology roles with 1‚Äì2 years of hands-on experience designing and implementing AI solutions in a business, ideally in a performance marketing, adtech, or agency setting
  • Demonstrated proficiency in prompt engineering across commercial LLMs (e.g. OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini)
  • Hands-on experience building and orchestrating agents or building AI-powered workflows, ideally using platforms like LangChain, AutoGen, or custom frameworks
  • Familiarity with data pipelines and ETL tools to manage structured and unstructured data for AI inputs
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to translate technical approaches into value for product and operations teams
  • Experience collaborating with engineering and product teams in agile environments
  • Ability to manage ambiguity, prioritize impact, and move quickly from prototype to solution



Nice To Have


  • A background in digital marketing, media, or analytics with a strong understanding of performance metrics and Martech ecosystems
  • Experience working with vector databases, semantic search, or RAG implementations
  • Familiarity with analytics and data visualization platforms (e.g. Google Analytics 4, Looker Studio, Looker, BigQuery)
  • Exposure to prompt evaluation frameworks or agent performance testing environments
  • Experience working with customer-facing or internal tools for productivity or marketing intelligence



Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Wpromote.

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.

json.companyDescription:
Wpromote is a top independent marketing agency that challenges convention to accelerate growth for brands. We believe every client, including legacy enterprise brands like Whirlpool, category leaders like Spanx, and fast-growing DTCs like Vuori, can maximize the business impact of media with the right outcomes-driven partner. 

Our holistic total commerce approach drives transformative results for retail brands across channels and purchase points, powered by our Challenger culture, deep business intelligence, and predictive Polaris platform. To stay ahead of the rapid evolution of commerce and consumer behavior, we put data-driven testing and experimentation at the heart of our organization and delivery model so our clients can outsmart instead of outspend the competition and move fast to capitalize on opportunities in an ever-changing media ecosystem
json.companySlogan:
Challenging Convention, Accelerating Growth
8-Time Ad Age Best Place To Work

json.title: Automation Engineer
json.descriptionHtml:
DMI is a leading provider of digital services and technology solutions, headquartered in Tysons Corner, VA. With a focus on end-to-end managed IT services, including managed mobility, cloud, cybersecurity, network operations, and application development, DMI supports public sector agencies and commercial enterprises around the globe. Recognized as a Top Workplace, DMI is committed to delivering secure, efÔ¨Åcient, and cost-effective solutions that drive measurable results. Learn more at www.dminc.com

About The Opportunity

DMI, LLC is seeking an Automation Engineer Senior to join us.

Duties And Responsibilities

The Automation Engineer focuses on automating network operations to enhance efficiency, integrating AI/ML recommendations. Their duties include:

  • Automation Development: Developing and maintaining automation scripts and tools to streamline network configuration, monitoring, and maintenance tasks. This involves using tools like Ansible, Python, and APIs.
  • Integration of Recommendations: Integrating AI/ML-based recommendation systems into network management platforms to assist operators with troubleshooting, ensuring operators receive the top three error causes and fixes.
  • Data Pipeline Automation: Automating data collection, preprocessing, and feature engineering pipelines to support AI/ML model training and inference, ensuring data flows efficiently into models.
  • Scalability and Reliability: Ensuring automation solutions are robust, scalable, and can manage a large-scale network with over 5,000 devices, addressing the complexity of such environments. This includes ensuring high availability.
  • Collaboration with AI/ML Teams: Collaborating with AI/ML engineers to deploy, monitor, and update machine learning models in production environments, ensuring seamless integration. This partnership is essential for operationalizing AI insights.
  • Troubleshooting Automation Issues: Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to automation tools, scripts, and integrations, maintaining system reliability.
  • Continuous Improvement: Continuously improving automation processes to increase efficiency and reduce operational overhead, aligning with the goal of network efficiencies.

Qualifications

Education and Years of Experience:

  • BS 5-7 Years, MS 3-5, PhD 0-2

Required And Desired Skills/Certifications

  • Systems analysis and troubleshooting skills
  • Knowledge of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP)

Additional Requirements: Successful completion of a Public Trust background investigation and a Public Trust clearance.

Min Citizenship Status Required: Must be a U.S. Citizen

Physical Requirements: No Physical requirement needed for this position .

Location: Remote, US

Working at DMI

Benefits

DMI is a diverse, prosperous, and rewarding place to work. Being part of the DMI family means we care about your wellbeing. As such, we offer a variety of perks and benefits that help meet various interests and needs, while still having the opportunity to work directly with a number of our award-winning, Fortune 1000 clients. The following categories make up your DMI wellbeing:

  • Convenience/Concierge - Virtual visits through health insurance, pet insurance, commuter benefits, discount tickets for movies, travel, and many other items to provide convenience.
  • Development ‚Äì Annual performance management, continuing education, and tuition assistance, internal job opportunities along with career enrichment and advancement to help each employee with their professional and personal development.
  • Financial ‚Äì Generous 401k matches both pre-tax and post-tax (ROTH) contributions along with financial wellness education, EAP, Life Insurance and Disability help provide financial stability for each DMI employee.
  • Recognition ‚Äì Great achievements do not go unnoticed by DMI through Annual Awards ceremony, service anniversaries, peer-to-peer acknowledgment, employee referral bonuses.
  • Wellness ‚Äì Healthcare benefits, Wellness programs, Flu Shots, Biometric screenings, and several other wellness options.

Employees are valued for their talents and contributions. We all take pride in helping our customers achieve their goals, which in turn contributes to the overall success of the company.

  • No Agencies Please *****************

Applicants selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. US citizenship may be required for some positions.

Job ID: 2025-28055

json.title: Head of AI Strategy & Innovation
json.descriptionHtml:
The Role

Wpromote is seeking a forward-thinking, execution-driven Head of AI Strategy & Innovation to lead the strategic integration of AI across the organization. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of Wpromote by turning the potential of AI into real-world outcomes‚Äîdriving efficiency, enhancing our product offerings, and creating meaningful market differentiation. With a strong foundation in AI systems, digital marketing, and operational design, this leader will serve as both a visionary strategist and a hands-on operator.

In this high-impact role, you‚Äôll lead the execution of Wpromote‚Äôs five-part AI strategy, identifying high-value opportunities for transformation and designing scalable solutions with measurable ROI. You‚Äôll manage a Director of AI Solutions focused on prompt engineering and QA, partner with cross-functional teams across Product, Transformation & Integration, Central Operations, and Delivery, and work with external consultants to bring early-stage innovations to life. This is your chance to architect the next chapter of AI-powered performance and innovation at Wpromote.

At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in marketing.

We offer:


  • Remote-first culture
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Extended Holiday break (Winter)
  • Flexible schedules
  • Work from anywhere options*
  • 100% paid parental leave
  • 401(k) matching
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
  • Sponsored life insurance
  • Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
  • Annual Class Pass credits and more!



The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $190,000 - $230,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state‚Äôs salary threshold for exempt employees. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above) and an annual performance bonus.

This role has an associated annual target bonus component which is paid out based on a number of factors which include Company performance, department performance, and individual performance. Bonuses are not guaranteed and you must be an active employee in good standing and not on a Performance Improvement Plan to be eligible for the annual bonus.


  • This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions
  • While this role offers the flexibility to work remotely, we have office hubs in Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York, where you can join in on learning and development opportunities, fun events, take advantage of a space to work, and collaborate in person!
  • This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship



Important Notice: Beware of Job Scams

Wpromote recruiting communications will only be sent through our official channels via wpromote.com email addresses. If you see a posting elsewhere that is not reflected on Wpromote.com/careers, it may be a fraudulent posting. We do not require payment or fees during the hiring process nor do we request sensitive information, such as Social Security numbers or payment details. Please safeguard yourself against possible scams and contact us if you encounter any suspicious activity.

You Will Be


  • Accelerating gross margin efficiency gains through AI automation of top ‚Äújobs to be done‚Äù
  • Embedding differentiated AI agents that offer differentiated takeaways, insights, and recommendations in PolarisIQ product experiences in partnership with Product and Engineering
  • Delivering ROI-positive AI solutions across marketing service delivery
  • Fueling thought leadership and pipeline with always-on AI marketing content
  • Designing role-specific AI training programs in partnership with L&D
  • Managing a Director of AI Solutions, who will be responsible for prompt engineering, QA, building AI agents, data pipeline configuration, and no-code AI solution implementation
  • Owning the prioritization, business case evaluation, and requirement gathering for AI initiatives‚Äîfocusing on scalable, high-return use cases
  • Partnering with Product and DSA on AI-powered agentic feature design, UX enhancements, prompt workflows, and no-code alternatives to traditional development
  • Collaborating with Transformation &Innovation, Central Operations, People Operations, IT, and business unit leaders to design and implement AI-augmented operational processes, delivering measurable efficiency or capability gains
  • Leading research and internal education efforts to identify which emerging AI technologies and tools are most relevant to Wpromote‚Äôs business model
  • Supporting business stakeholders with 3P AI-vendor evaluations, pilot design, and scaling change management into operations
  • Driving internal communications and external thought leadership around AI marketing impact, use cases, product innovations, and current trends
  • Designing and curating scalable training curricula in partnership with Learning & Development and department leaders to raise agency-wide AI fluency



You Must Have


  • 8+ years of experience in strategy, innovation, or technology roles with 1-2 years of hands-on experience designing and implementing AI solutions in a business, in a performance marketing, adtech, or advertising agency setting
  • Previous people management experience
  • Demonstrated expertise in evaluating, designing, and deploying AI solutions that drive operational scale and/or product differentiation
  • Familiarity with AI tools and approaches including LLMs, agentic workflows, prompt design, vector databases, and no-/low-code platforms
  • A strategic mindset with proven experience building prioritization frameworks and assessing ROI on innovation investments
  • Outstanding stakeholder management and communication skills, with a track record of translating technical potential into business value
  • Experience partnering with product and engineering teams to ship AI-enhanced features and workflows
  • Skilled at navigating ambiguity and leading cross-functional teams toward alignment, momentum, and measurable outcomes



Nice to Have


  • Experience working with external consultants or vendors to accelerate innovation delivery
  • Familiarity with AI software evaluation frameworks and structured experimentation methods
  • Understanding of marketing analytics and digital media KPIs
  • Exposure to training and change enablement programs for technical and non-technical audiences



Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Wpromote.

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.

json.companyDescription:
Wpromote is a top independent marketing agency that challenges convention to accelerate growth for brands. We believe every client, including legacy enterprise brands like Whirlpool, category leaders like Spanx, and fast-growing DTCs like Vuori, can maximize the business impact of media with the right outcomes-driven partner. 

Our holistic total commerce approach drives transformative results for retail brands across channels and purchase points, powered by our Challenger culture, deep business intelligence, and predictive Polaris platform. To stay ahead of the rapid evolution of commerce and consumer behavior, we put data-driven testing and experimentation at the heart of our organization and delivery model so our clients can outsmart instead of outspend the competition and move fast to capitalize on opportunities in an ever-changing media ecosystem

json.title: Head of Operations
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Role

We are hiring a high-impact Director of Operations to lead our Professional Services and Customer Support functions within a single B2B software company. You will be accountable for full departmental P&L ownership, key operating metrics, and the strategic direction and execution of both teams. You will work closely with the President in executing plans for customer satisfaction, growth and key projects.

This role is ideal for a hands-on operator with strong financial discipline, a systems-thinking mindset, and a passion for leveraging AI and automation to drive efficiency and innovation. You will serve as a key driver of pricing and packaging models across both support and services ‚Äî advancing our offerings to improve customer outcomes while fueling revenue growth and profitability.

Responsibilities

Financial & Strategic Ownership

  • Own the full P&Ls for Professional Services and Customer Support, including revenue generation, cost control, and margin optimization.
  • Define and manage operating metrics, such as PS utilization, backlog, project margin, CSAT/NPS, resolution times, and ticket deflection.
  • Drive pricing and packaging strategies across both PS and Support functions to expand attach rates, drive renewals, and capture additional value.
  • Lead strategic planning and execution of departmental OKRs aligned with company growth and profitability goals.

Professional Services (PS)

  • Lead the end-to-end delivery of onboarding, implementation, training, and integration engagements.
  • Own and evolve the Professional Services catalog, ensuring it reflects customer needs, market trends, and profitability targets.
  • Take accountability for pricing, discounting strategy, and packaging of PS offerings, working closely with Finance and Sales.
  • Improve project management and delivery processes to reduce time-to-value and increase margins.

Customer Support (CS)

  • Lead a customer-focused, SLA-driven support organization that balances responsiveness, efficiency, and cost.
  • Optimize the support model (tiering, tooling, staffing) to meet the needs of a growing and diverse customer base.
  • Advance support packaging and monetization models (e.g., premium support tiers, implementation success plans) to drive recurring revenue.

AI & Automation Leadership

  • Champion the adoption of AI tools, automation, and self-service platforms to increase scalability and operational efficiency.
  • Implement and continuously improve AI-powered support agents and customer-facing workflows to reduce reliance on human intervention.
  • Embed AI capabilities into the service catalog and internal processes, unlocking new revenue and efficiency opportunities.
  • Provide training and tooling that enables teams to effectively collaborate with AI in daily operations.

People & Performance

  • Hire, develop, and retain top talent across PS and CS functions.
  • Establish clear performance expectations and accountability systems across both teams.
  • Promote a culture of ownership, continuous improvement, and customer-centric execution.

Requirements

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of operational leadership in B2B software or SaaS businesses, with direct oversight of PS and/or CS teams. Demonstrated P&L ownership and experience driving revenue and profitability improvements.
  • Strong expertise in pricing, packaging, and monetizing services and support.
  • Experience building or evolving a Professional Services catalog, including commercial strategy and execution.
  • Track record of successfully implementing AI tools and automation in service delivery or customer support environments.
  • Implemented key strategic projects with demonstrated results.
  • Strategic thinker with excellent financial, analytical, and leadership skills.
  • Hands-on execution capability and a bias toward action.

Valsoft Operating Culture

  • Valsoft acquires and operates vertical market software businesses for the long term. Our operators are: Owners, not managers ‚Äî You lead with accountability and act like the business is yours.
  • Decentralized and autonomous ‚Äî You make decisions close to the problem and the customer.
  • Focused on durable growth ‚Äî You prioritize systems, people, and models that create long-term value. Lean and hands-on ‚Äî You are deeply involved, pragmatic, and results-driven.
  • Preferred Qualifications
  • Familiarity with PSA tools (e.g., Mavenlink, NetSuite, Salesforce PSA) and support systems (e.g., Zendesk, Jira, Intercom).
  • Experience leading services or support in a hybrid perpetual/SaaS business.
  • Background in developing premium support offerings, services monetization, or customer success programs.
  • Prior experience in investor-backed or acquisition-driven businesses.

Benefits

  • Competitive base salary with performance-based profit-sharing bonus
  • 401(k) matching up to 4%
  • Healthcare, Dental and Life insurance
  • Education reimbursement
  • Unlimited PTO

We actively support our businesses, guiding them in their growth and evolution into market leaders. 

Headquartered in Montreal with a global presence, Valsoft is committed to building a legacy of excellence by prioritizing sustainable growth and operational efficiency. Our long-term vision, driven by entrepreneurial spirit and disciplined execution, ensures we create lasting value for our portfolio companies, their customers, and the industries they serve. For more information, visit valsoftcorp.com.

json.title: Director of Artificial Intelligence
json.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking an experienced leader to drive the vision and execution of cutting-edge AI/ML solutions. This role involves rapid experimentation, scalable system development, and collaborative problem-solving to deliver impactful business outcomes. You‚Äôll lead a talented team of engineers and data scientists, designing and deploying enterprise-level AI systems focused on automation, optimization, and strategic decision-making.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategic Leadership: Define and execute AI/ML strategy, identifying opportunities to deliver measurable outcomes through advanced solutions.
  • System Development: Lead the creation of prototypes, MVPs, and scalable AI platforms from experimentation to enterprise deployment.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with teams across the business to understand challenges and develop AI-driven solutions using ML, generative AI, NLP, and more.
  • Applied AI Innovation: Build systems addressing areas such as forecasting, automation, optimization, and user engagement while promoting data-driven thinking.
  • Team Leadership: Recruit, mentor, and inspire a diverse team, fostering a culture of curiosity, experimentation, and continuous learning.


Must-Have Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven track record of bringing AI solutions from concept to production in fast-paced environments.
  • 10+ years in software engineering, AI/ML, or applied analytics.
  • Proficiency with ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, MLFlow, and coding in Python (or similar).
  • Expertise in cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Strong communicator with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, & scalable AI deployments

Preferred Skills

  • PhD or advanced research in ML, NLP, or AI fields.
  • Hands-on experience with real-time systems, large-scale data, or multimodal AI (e.g., text, image, time series).
