json.title: Founding Software Engineer (Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
Gridlines is an early-stage venture-backed startup building AI agents for financial analysts. We are a remote-first company.

Our Co-Founders

Gridlines was founded by Stephanie Goldman and Ning Yang, who bring deep expertise from their careers in investment banking and private equity. The co-founders met while working at Barclays, where they experienced firsthand the time-consuming, manual processes that financial analysts face daily.

Our Team

Our team currently consists of our two co-founders plus one engineer, and we're looking to add our second engineer. As such an early hire, you'll have significant influence on our technical direction, architecture decisions, and engineering culture. This is a rare opportunity to join a tight-knit team where your contributions will directly shape the product and company trajectory.

Our Stack

  • Typescript / React to build our app as a PowerPoint add-in on the frontend
  • Python via FastAPI on the backend
  • We have services in C# as well

Company Overview

We are seeking an exceptional Full-Stack Engineer who combines technical excellence with self-motivated problem-solving abilities. We're looking for someone who thrives in ambiguous environments, takes ownership of complex challenges, and has a track record of delivering high-quality software solutions independently.

This is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic startup where your programming skills and proactive approach will have significant impact. As an early-stage company, you'll work across the full stack and contribute to various aspects of our AI-powered platform for financial analysts.

Backend Development

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance backend systems and APIs to support our computer vision applications and other product features.
  • Implement best practices for code quality, testing, and deployment automation to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.

Frontend Development

  • Develop user-friendly interfaces and interactive features using modern web technologies.
  • Collaborate with designers to implement intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces. Ensure responsive design and optimal performance across different devices and platforms.

Database Management

  • Design and optimize database schemas and queries for efficient data retrieval and storage. Work on ways to improve data management processes, including data collection, preprocessing, and storage.

Infrastructure Development

  • Contribute to the overall software architecture and infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security.
  • Utilize cloud computing platforms, such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP), to deploy and manage backend services and applications.

Collaboration And Communication

  • Work closely with team members to understand project requirements, provide technical expertise, and deliver high-quality solutions.
  • Participate in regular team meetings and contribute to brainstorming sessions, sharing ideas, and offering constructive feedback.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of work experience as a software engineer with demonstrated excellence in programming fundamentals.
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Exceptional proficiency in backend and frontend development languages, such as Python, JavaScript (React), and/or C#.
  • Strong understanding of database systems, including SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Knowledge of RESTful API design principles and experience building and consuming APIs.
  • Familiarity with software development best practices, version control systems (e.g., Git), and agile methodologies.
  • Solid understanding of computer vision principles, techniques, and algorithms.
  • Proven track record of successfully delivering full-stack projects from design to deployment.
  • Self-motivated problem solver who can work independently and take ownership of complex technical challenges.
  • Strong programming fundamentals with attention to code quality, performance, and maintainability.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to overcome technical challenges.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Thrives in startup environments with ambiguity and rapidly changing priorities.

If you are passionate about full-stack development, combining backend, frontend, and computer vision, and want to work with cutting-edge technologies, we would love to hear from you. To apply, please submit your resume, along with a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining our team.

json.companyDescription:
Are you tired of conventional, slow-paced financial modelling that leaves you in the dark until the last minute? We were, too.

That's why our team, which collectively has hundreds of years of experience in high-stakes financial modelling, came together with one belief: there's a better way.

Our mission is clear: to redefine modelling with faster, more insightful solutions. With Gridlines, it's all about clarity, speed, and ease.

WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT
Financial modelling isn't just a service we offer. It's what we live and breathe every day. That drives us to constantly innovate, find smarter ways, and set better standards for you and the entire industry.

SERVICES WE PROVIDE:
Model build: Our models are robust, flexible, and easy to understand, enabling you to make confident, high-quality, timely decisions.
Model audit: Ranked 2nd globally in the Inframation league tables (Jan-April 2024), and having completed 100+ audits, industry leaders trust us to ensure their model is robust and error-free.
Financial modelling training: Transform your skills and confidence with our FREE Essential Financial Modelling course, covering core and advanced modelling topics.

WHO WE WORK WITH
With a global client base, we've worked with leading institutions on some of the world's biggest finance projects.
Clients include Siemens, Masdar, Barclays, The World Bank, EDF, Citibank, Ofgem, Total, Suez and more.

SECTORS
Renewable energy
Aviation
Health
Water
Transport

OUR PROMISE TO YOU
We help clients make better decisions - because better decisions mean a better future for all of us. So, whether you're paving the way for your next big infrastructure project, navigating a merger, or a high-value investment opportunity, why not join the ever-growing league of industry leaders who already trust Gridlines to support their critical decisions?
Get in touch today for a free consultation.
www.gridlines.com/contact-us
json.companySlogan: Model build | Model Audit | Financial modelling training

json.title: Freelance GenAI Developer - Prompt Engineering & Data Workflows
json.descriptionHtml:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:

  • Develop and submit precise answers based on complex prompts, including coding, automation, and data processing tasks
  • Write and optimize Python scripts for data analysis, automation, and verification
  • Work with large datasets efficiently, ensuring data is clean and well-structured
  • Utilize various LLMs to generate advanced prompts and improve AI output quality
  • Format outputs in required structures such as Markdown, JSON, tables, etc
  • Identify and troubleshoot non-trivial technical problems related to AI workflows and integrations


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You hold a Master's or Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related technical fields.
  • You have a strong technical background and hands-on experience with LLMs and AI frameworks to enhance automation and problem-solving
  • You possess data analysis and automation skills, with experience in scripting (e.g., Python) for task efficiency
  • You are proficient in working with large datasets and integrating data from multiple sources
  • You are able to develop, test, and optimize AI-driven workflows and tools
  • Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Welcome to Mindrift ‚Äî a space where innovation meets opportunity. We‚Äôre a pioneering platform dedicated to advancing the field of artificial intelligence through collaborative online projects. Our focus lies in creating data for generative AI, offering a unique chance for freelancers to contribute to AI development from anywhere, at any time.

At Mindrift, we believe in the power of collective intelligence to shape the future of AI. Our platform allows users to dive into a variety of tasks ‚Äî ranging from creating training prompts for AI models to refining AI responses for greater relevance.

Let‚Äôs build the future of AI together, one task at a time.

json.title: Implementation Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
FirmPilot is the leading growth platform for law firms looking to scale with precision. We combine AI-driven insights, marketing automation, and data-backed performance to help firms convert traffic into retained clients. We are a fast-paced, venture-backed startup scaling with serious momentum and an eye for operational excellence.

About the Role

We are looking for an Implementation Specialist who can own the client onboarding experience from post-sale handoff through full deployment and ongoing platform success. You will work cross-functionally to deliver seamless integrations, guide firms through our product setup, and ensure long-term value through continuous support.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, has a deep sense of ownership, and brings a service-oriented mindset to technical execution. A strong candidate will not just handle onboarding, but also offer ongoing support and maintenance after onboarding to ensure our clients remain successful well beyond launch.

What You Will Do

  • Lead onboarding for new clients by coordinating internal resources, setting clear expectations, and configuring platform access
  • Own the full setup lifecycle from technical kickoffs through go-live milestones
  • Customize marketing automation flows, contact integrations, domain settings, and conversion tracking based on client needs
  • Translate complex digital marketing and technical concepts into easy-to-follow instructions for legal teams
  • Offer post-onboarding support to ensure continued success, including proactive check-ins, minor adjustments, and troubleshooting
  • Provide technical guidance to clients on web integrations, intake systems, and third-party tools
  • Maintain documentation of each implementation, including status updates, outstanding items, and resolution logs
  • Identify patterns in client feedback and work with the Product and Success teams to improve implementation efficiency and satisfaction

What You Bring

  • 4+ years of experience in implementation, client onboarding, or technical account management
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple client timelines at once
  • Comfort working across cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Customer Success, and Product
  • Experience with web-based platforms, CRM tools, form builders, analytics tools, or martech systems
  • Client-first mindset and a drive to ensure value is delivered beyond onboarding
  • Ability to remain composed and solution-oriented under pressure

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to basic HTML, Google Analytics, or CMS platforms like WordPress
  • Experience working in a startup or fast-growth SaaS environment
  • Understanding of legal services or professional services industries

This role is a Hybrid position, that will require occasional travel to FirmPilots HQ for team collaboration.

Expected salary range for this role: $100,000 - $115,000

json.title: VP, Engineering
json.descriptionHtml:
At Acorns, our mission is to look after the financial best interests of the up-and-coming, beginning with the empowering, proud step of micro-investing. How do we accomplish our mission? Our values.

Lead With Heart - With compassion, integrity, and tenacity, inspire yourself and others to move past all previous thresholds of possibility

Make Bold Decisions - We are creating a new world. Be optimistic, adventurous, and courageous. Leap fearlessly into the future

Always Build Trust - Say what you mean, mean what you say, and do what you say you‚Äôre going to do. We are all owners. We are one team

Never Stop Growing - Change IS the constant. Stay hungry and curious. Be relentless in the pursuit of progress

Find a way - Never settle, no excuses, nothing is impossible. Just make it happen

Our values guide us, and our mission drives us. Come join us and help deliver financial wellness for the whole family, putting the tools of wealth-making into everyone‚Äôs hands.

___________________________________________________________________________

VP, Engineering | Acorns

Every small money decision, whether it‚Äôs saving, investing, or staying consistent, relies on a system that makes it feel simple and rewarding. At Acorns, engineers build these systems. They turn everyday actions into lasting financial progress.

We‚Äôre not just building an app. We‚Äôre building a financial wellness system that helps people grow their money, build healthy financial habits, and feel better about their futures, often for the first time. That means every architectural choice, every reliability improvement, every AI-powered feature contributes to something bigger than software. It adds up to real emotional impact.

We‚Äôre looking for a Vice President of Engineering to help us grow that impact. You will lead a talented, mission-driven team and partner with our Chief Technology Officer to define the technical strategy, elevate engineering practices, develop high-quality products, and strengthen the connection between product, design, data, and engineering. You will help us build for the long term with systems that are scalable, resilient, and human-centered. And you will help us integrate AI into everything we do to boost team velocity and deepen the support we give our customers.

This isn‚Äôt just about shipping fast. It‚Äôs about shipping with intention. It‚Äôs about leading a team that builds with care, for the craft, for the mission, and for the millions of people counting on us to make money feel less overwhelming and more empowering.

If that sounds like the kind of work you‚Äôre ready to lead, we‚Äôd love to meet you.

Acorns is a remote-first organization, offering the flexibility to work remotely while providing optional access to office space in Irvine, CA.

What You Will Do At Acorns

Strategic & Technical Vision

  • Drive AI adoption, envisioning how AI can empower engineers and enhance the customer experience.
  • Partner with stakeholders to create a cohesive vision for delivering a Financial Wellness System that helps our customers manage their everyday finances. You will drive cross-functional engagement, stakeholders even as priorities shift.
  • Ensure the scalability and reliability of systems, optimizing cloud architecture for cost efficiency and performance.
  • Maintain deep expertise in Acorns‚Äô software stack, serving as a technical authority within the company.

Organizational Leadership & Talent Development

  • Attract, hire, and retain top engineering talent to ensure Acorns remains a hub for technical excellence.
  • Establish an education program to keep our engineers at the forefront of the best engineering techniques.
  • Design and scale onshore and offshore teams effectively, including managing organizational changes driven by attrition or hiring needs.
  • Create a culture of engineering excellence demonstrated by DORA metrics, AI usage metrics, cycle times, and defect escape rates.
  • Cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset among leaders, encouraging ownership, industry engagement, and thought leadership.

Driving Clarity

  • Balance competing priorities between speed, quality, and business impact while staying aligned with company goals and operating within a defined annual budget.
  • Lead teams through ambiguous challenges, clearly articulate the ‚Äòwhy‚Äô behind decisions to foster buy-in and alignment.
  • Provide clear and frequent high-impact updates to executives, ensuring transparency and alignment across teams.

Financial & Operational Responsibility

  • Optimize budget and payroll management, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
  • Strengthen MarTech capabilities, enhancing marketing attribution tracking.
  • Ensure public readiness and compliance, preparing the org for industry regulations and future growth.
  • Drive incident management, ensuring rapid issue resolution and continuous momentum.

Industry Awareness & Business Development

  • Stay ahead of industry trends, ensuring Acorns remains a leader in engineering best practices.
  • Conduct build vs. buy evaluations, determining when to invest in in-house solutions or external tools.
  • Make strategic sunsetting decisions, retiring outdated technologies and processes efficiently.
  • Secure optimal vendor contracts and negotiate trade-offs that maximize value for Acorns.

What You Will Bring To Acorns

  • 15+ years of engineering experience, with 7+ years in senior leadership roles (Director, VP, or equivalent).
  • Proven ability to design, scale, and restructure engineering teams in high-growth environments.
  • Deep knowledge of software architecture, cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), system scalability, coding standards, databases, and incident management.
  • Experience leading AI-driven engineering initiatives and automation strategies.
  • Exceptional business acumen, with the ability to align engineering efforts with financial objectives and revenue impact.
  • Industry awareness, with experience in M&A due diligence and technology partnerships.
  • Change management and communication skills, with the ability to align teams through organizational shifts.
  • Exceptional executive communication, including presenting complex ideas to stakeholders.
  • Ability to influence and drive alignment across engineering, product, and business teams.
  • Experience fostering an entrepreneurial, ownership-driven culture within teams.
  • Demonstrated experience motivating, supporting, and developing team members to meet performance expectations and build their careers
  • Ability to align company vision and organizational goals with team execution
  • Commitment to upholding policy and procedures per company standards
  • Own strategic decision-making and effectively communicate direction to team members
  • Hunger to deliver game-changing products
  • Exceptional drive and precision in delivery
  • A belief that your work is tied to your life's mission
  • Optimistic about the potential of societal change

You are not expected to have experience with all listed requirements. If you feel passionate about Acorns' mission, vision, and values, please apply.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • A comprehensive benefits package for you and your family
  • Flexible work location, hours, and paid time off
  • 401(k) matching
  • Monthly Acorns account contribution & GoHenry account for your family
  • Mindfulness and Financial Wellness resources, Headspace and Addition Wealth
  • Acorns Career Development Program (Ongoing training sessions, development plans, development check-ins, Cornerstone‚Äôs online training platform)
  • Roots Leadership Program for Emerging Leaders
  • Community week onsite gatherings and various virtual events
  • Talented and motivated team members who care deeply about one another, our mission, and our customers.
  • The rare opportunity to create a new world. We inspire one another every day to do meaningful work that solves major societal challenges.

About Acorns

Acorns is a financial wellness app that helps everyday people and families save and invest money for the long term. Since 2014, Acorns has grown into a global company with multiple life-stage products serving the needs of kids, teens, adults, and parents. Named one of Time‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Best Brands of 2024,‚Äù Acorns has helped over 14 million people save & invest over $25 billion dollars, much of it from spare change and small amounts.

Management Principles

  • Managers are constantly raising the bar
  • Managers ensure all team members have a voice and a path
  • No surprises - Managers give and receive feedback early and often
  • Managers continuously assess performance action on concerns quickly
  • Managers foster a resilient, results-oriented mindset

Compensation Information

The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $304,000 and $355,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a sign-on bonus, equity grants, and discretionary cash bonus awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

If hired, employee will be in an ‚Äúat-will position‚Äù and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Work Authorization

Acorns participates in E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. For more information about E-Verify, please visit www.e-verify.gov

How do we accomplish our mission? Our values.Lead With Heart - With compassion, integrity, and tenacity, inspire yourself and others to move past all previous thresholds of possibilityMake Bold Decisions - We are creating a new world. Be optimistic, adventurous, and courageous. Leap fearlessly into the futureAlways Build Trust - Say what you mean, mean what you say, and do what you say you‚Äôre going to do. We are all owners. We are one teamNever Stop Growing - Change IS the constant. Stay hungry and curious. Be relentless in the pursuit of progressFind a way - Never settle, no excuses, nothing is impossible. Just make it happenOur values guide us, and our mission drives us. json.title: AI QA Tester
json.descriptionHtml:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC), is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

AI QA Tester II

Our client is building cutting-edge GenAI products and looking for a sharp QA professional who thrives at the intersection of innovation and precision. This is a unique opportunity to help shape how responsible AI is tested both technically and ethically while working closely with a high-performing, cross-functional team.

If you re excited about defining testing strategy, diving into functional code, and creatively challenging a product s capabilities, this role has your name on it.

  • Location: Remote
  • Compensation: This job is expected to pay about 60-70/HR W2
  • No Visa Sponsorship Available for this role

What You ll Do:

  • Develop and execute comprehensive testing strategies for GenAI-based applications, including functional, performance, regression, and usability testing
  • Create and maintain detailed test plans, cases, and scripts to ensure software quality aligns with responsible AI principles
  • Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to align testing efforts with project goals and user expectations
  • Identify, document, and track defects using test management and bug tracking tools, supporting root cause analysis and resolution
  • Design nuanced and creative tests to detect hallucination, bias, and consistency issues in AI output

What Gets You the Job:

  • 6 9 years of QA or software testing experience with strong analytical skills and a sharp eye for detail
  • Prior experience testing GenAI products or deep familiarity with Responsible AI principles, or a background in data science within a risk-focused domain
  • Hands-on experience with UI testing tools such as Playwright or Selenium; familiarity with automation frameworks like Pytest or Jest is a plus
  • Solid grasp of the SDLC, QA methodologies, and test strategy design able to operate independently and lead testing direction when needed
  • Comfortable reading or writing test scripts with basic programming or scripting knowledge

If you're ready to apply your QA expertise to one of the most exciting areas in tech, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume today and take the next step toward building smarter, more responsible AI.

If we are still actively screening for this role, our AI Recruiter, Avery will email you to schedule a virtual meeting to learn more about your background.

Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) connects top talent with exceptional opportunities in IT, Security, Engineering, and Design. From startups to Fortune 500s, we partner with leading companies nationwide. Our AI recruiter, Avery helps streamline the first step of your journey so we can focus on what matters most: helping you grow. Join us. Let us ELEVATE your career!

Irvine Technology Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Irvine Technology Corporation complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

json.descriptionHtml:
Our client, an event management company in the east coast is looking for an IT leader to join the team. This is a small company, so you will be hands-on and work on setting visions for the future of IT within the company. Fully remote role that will work EST hours.


  • Collaborate with executive leadership on technology strategy, budget planning, and vendor management to support business objectives
  • Lead and manage all aspects of IT infrastructure, including Windows servers, networks, firewalls, system administration, security and DevOps strategy
  • Design and maintain scalable, secure environments for both internal systems and client-facing applications, supporting organizational growth
  • Provide strategic and technical leadership with software developers, reviewing architecture, and aligning technical direction with business goals
  • Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies, including AI and automation tools, to improve efficiency and innovation
  • Implement robust system monitoring, backup, disaster recovery, and endpoint security protocols to safeguard business continuity



  • 10+years of experience
  • Very hands on with an infrastructure focus and leading application developers
  • Strong strategic experience

json.title: Hyper Automation and AI Automation Process Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, EA Team, Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Position: Hyper Automation and AI Automation Process Specialist

Location: Remote

Duration: 3 Months

Job Description :

  • Conduct process discovery and feasibility assessments, collaborating with business SMEs to identify automation candidates across Tax, Advisory, and Corporate functions.
  • Design, develop, and implement RPA workflows, Agents using Automation Anywhere (A360 preferred),copilots/GenAI tools ensuring alignment with technical and process standards.
  • Build and deploy GenAI-enhanced components (e.g., intelligent summarization, data extraction, classification), Agents using Azure OpenAI and related APIs.
  • Create reusable prompt libraries, action blocks, connectors, and modular design patterns for scalable and maintainable automation.
  • Support end-to-end automation lifecycle: solution design, development, unit testing, UAT support, deployment, and transition to operations.
  • Monitor deployed automations, identify optimization opportunities, and recommend enhancements for resiliency and performance.
  • Key Deliverable: Deliver production-ready automation workflows and GenAI-based use cases, along with full documentation, test cases, and operational support material.

json.title: Product Director
json.descriptionHtml:
Product Director - AEC / Construction Technology

Location and Territory: Remote, US

Start Date: Immediate


Want to help shape the future of ConTech right from the front lines?


We‚Äôre looking for a Product Director to lead high-impact, ground-up innovation at the intersection of AI, data, and large-scale U.S. construction. This role is built for someone who‚Äôs spent time on-site, understands how projects really run, and is now ready to turn that hard-earned experience into smart, scalable product solutions. If you're comfortable getting hands-on, navigating ambiguity, and driving results that actually move the needle then we want to hear from you.


Overview

A global force in construction technology, this organization harnesses AI and computer vision to automate progress tracking directly from the jobsite.


Its platform delivers highly accurate data, predictive performance analytics, and automation tools that improve visibility, boost efficiency, and drive project success.


Already trusted on large-scale builds across North America, the UK, and EMEA, the company is backed by top-tier venture capital, construction industry leaders, and experienced angel investors.


An opportunity has opened for a Product Director to lead some of the most strategic and exploratory product initiatives in the organization, where the variables are many, but the potential is significant.


This is a senior individual contributor role, ideal for someone with deep construction experience who now applies that perspective to product development. You‚Äôll engage directly with customers, collaborate across teams, and turn real-world challenges into scalable solutions.


From initial concept through to delivery, you‚Äôll take full ownership, conducting hands-on discovery, shaping design, and working closely with R&D to bring new ideas to life. It‚Äôs a role that demands agility between strategy and execution, translating early-stage thinking into tangible product impact.


Where you will make a difference

  • Own high-impact product initiatives from concept to integration within Buildots‚Äô core product, ensuring short-term execution aligns with long-term strategy.
  • Identify and validate new product opportunities by collaborating with clients, data teams, and internal stakeholders.
  • Develop and execute rapid proof-of-concept initiatives that can be quickly validated and refined into scalable product features.
  • Work closely with R&D, ensuring that innovation is immediately actionable and seamlessly embedded into the product.
  • Drive ROI-driven decision-making, assessing the commercial and operational impact of new capabilities.
  • Serve as a strategic partner to sales, CS, and operations, helping shape how Buildots delivers and supports its most innovative solutions.
  • Balance inbound and outbound product leadership, with a higher emphasis on inbound execution compared to traditional product management roles in the team.


Who you are

  • Proven construction expertise ‚Äì At least 5 years of experience in construction or engineering, preferably with on-site experience in large-scale projects.
  • Analytical and strategic thinking ‚Äì Exceptionally analytical, with a creative mindset and the ability to think strategically about complex problems.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities ‚Äì Able to take initiatives from concept to execution in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment.
  • Excellent communication skills ‚Äì Able to clearly articulate complex ideas and engage with executives, partners, and technical teams.
  • Technical and data-oriented ‚Äì Comfortable diving into the details of systems, data, and product mechanics to ensure smooth implementation.
  • Willing to travel internationally 4-6 times per year to engage with clients, teams, and industry events.


You'd be perfect if you

  • Are comfortable with both strategy and sleeves-rolled-up validation, you don‚Äôt wait for research, you go get it
  • Know how to run conversations on-site, in offices, and in exec reviews, you can navigate between detail and big picture
  • Thrive in ambiguity, but bias toward action, you're most useful when things are least clear
  • Care about outcomes, not just features, you measure success by real value delivered
json.descriptionText: Product Director - AEC / Construction TechnologyLocation and Territory: Remote, USStart Date: ImmediateWant to help shape the future of ConTech right from the front lines? We‚Äôre looking for a Product Director to lead high-impact, ground-up innovation at the intersection of AI, data, and large-scale U.S. construction. This role is built for someone who‚Äôs spent time on-site, understands how projects really run, and is now ready to turn that hard-earned experience into smart, scalable product solutions. If you're comfortable getting hands-on, navigating ambiguity, and driving results that actually move the needle then we want to hear from you.OverviewA global force in construction technology, this organization harnesses AI and computer vision to automate progress tracking directly from the jobsite. Its platform delivers highly accurate data, predictive performance analytics, and automation tools that improve visibility, boost efficiency, and drive project success. Already trusted on large-scale builds across North America, the UK, and EMEA, the company is backed by top-tier venture capital, construction industry leaders, and experienced angel investors.An opportunity has opened for a Product Director to lead some of the most strategic and exploratory product initiatives in the organization, where the variables are many, but the potential is significant. This is a senior individual contributor role, ideal for someone with deep construction experience who now applies that perspective to product development. You‚Äôll engage directly with customers, collaborate across teams, and turn real-world challenges into scalable solutions. From initial concept through to delivery, you‚Äôll take full ownership, conducting hands-on discovery, shaping design, and working closely with R&D to bring new ideas to life. It‚Äôs a role that demands agility between strategy and execution, translating early-stage thinking into tangible product impact.Where you will make a differenceOwn high-impact product initiatives from concept to integration within Buildots‚Äô core product, ensuring short-term execution aligns with long-term strategy. Identify and validate new product opportunities by collaborating with clients, data teams, and internal stakeholders. Develop and execute rapid proof-of-concept initiatives that can be quickly validated and refined into scalable product features. Work closely with R&D, ensuring that innovation is immediately actionable and seamlessly embedded into the product. Drive ROI-driven decision-making, assessing the commercial and operational impact of new capabilities. Serve as a strategic partner to sales, CS, and operations, helping shape how Buildots delivers and supports its most innovative solutions. Balance inbound and outbound product leadership, with a higher emphasis on inbound execution compared to traditional product management roles in the team.Who you areProven construction expertise ‚Äì At least 5 years of experience in construction or engineering, preferably with on-site experience in large-scale projects. Analytical and strategic thinking ‚Äì Exceptionally analytical, with a creative mindset and the ability to think strategically about complex problems. Strong problem-solving abilities ‚Äì Able to take initiatives from concept to execution in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment. Excellent communication skills ‚Äì Able to clearly articulate complex ideas and engage with executives, partners, and technical teams. Technical and data-oriented ‚Äì Comfortable diving into the details of systems, data, and product mechanics to ensure smooth implementation. Willing to travel internationally 4-6 times per year to engage with clients, teams, and industry events. You'd be perfect if you Are comfortable with both strategy and sleeves-rolled-up validation, you don‚Äôt wait for research, you go get it Know how to run conversations on-site, in offices, and in exec reviews, you can navigate between detail and big picture Thrive in ambiguity, but bias toward action, you're most useful when things are least clear Care about outcomes, not just features, you measure success by real value delivered

Kane Selection is owned and operated by a team of individuals who are hardworking, honest and ambitious. Coupling this with over a decade of experience, Kane Selection is the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù recruitment business for those looking for a company that speaks plainly and delivers the desired results.

We are here to support individuals looking to fulfil his/her next move, all the way to driving blue-chip international recruitment initiatives.

We welcome all parties to make contact for a discreet discussion. After all, we live in a busy world, and timing is everything. Let Kane Selection do the hard work for you, keeping you up to speed in real-time with those opportunities/talent in the market.

json.title: Freelance GenAI Developer - Prompt Engineering & Data Workflows
json.descriptionHtml:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:

  • Develop and submit precise answers based on complex prompts, including coding, automation, and data processing tasks
  • Write and optimize Python scripts for data analysis, automation, and verification
  • Work with large datasets efficiently, ensuring data is clean and well-structured
  • Utilize various LLMs to generate advanced prompts and improve AI output quality
  • Format outputs in required structures such as Markdown, JSON, tables, etc
  • Identify and troubleshoot non-trivial technical problems related to AI workflows and integrations


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You hold a Master's or Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related technical fields.
  • You have a strong technical background and hands-on experience with LLMs and AI frameworks to enhance automation and problem-solving
  • You possess data analysis and automation skills, with experience in scripting (e.g., Python) for task efficiency
  • You are proficient in working with large datasets and integrating data from multiple sources
  • You are able to develop, test, and optimize AI-driven workflows and tools
  • Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

json.companyDescription:
Welcome to Mindrift ‚Äî a space where innovation meets opportunity. We‚Äôre a pioneering platform dedicated to advancing the field of artificial intelligence through collaborative online projects. Our focus lies in creating data for generative AI, offering a unique chance for freelancers to contribute to AI development from anywhere, at any time.

At Mindrift, we believe in the power of collective intelligence to shape the future of AI. Our platform allows users to dive into a variety of tasks ‚Äî ranging from creating training prompts for AI models to refining AI responses for greater relevance.

Let‚Äôs build the future of AI together, one task at a time.
json.companySlogan: Be the ‚ÄúI‚Äù in AI with Mindrift. Work from anywhere on groundbreaking AI projects

json.title: Content Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
Miva is seeking a forward-thinking, AI-savvy Content Manager to join our Marketing team. In this role, you‚Äôll lead the charge in leveraging generative AI and automation tools to create, optimize, and scale high-performing content that drives sales, fuels demand generation, and engages customers across the funnel.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives at the intersection of creativity, AI, and automation‚Äîsomeone who knows how to prompt, edit, and refine AI-generated content and who understands how to use tools like Make.com, n8n, and Lindy to automate content workflows and boost output without sacrificing quality. You‚Äôll help define Miva‚Äôs voice while executing content strategies that expand visibility, generate qualified leads, and improve conversions across all channels.

You Will:

  • Own the content strategy across blog, social, email, and web
  • Use generative AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) to produce high-quality content at scale
  • Develop effective prompts and edit AI outputs to reflect brand tone and goals
  • Plan and manage the social media content calendar, ensuring a consistent presence and engagement
  • Write, edit, and schedule the weekly newsletter using AI and automation for rapid creation and personalization
  • Manage and publish all blog content, including SEO optimization and topical alignment
  • Use tools like Make.com, n8n, or Lindy to automate repetitive tasks and streamline content operations
  • Conduct regular audits to identify, repurpose, or update high-performing content using AI
  • Monitor and report on SEO rankings, engagement metrics, and performance trends
  • Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Design to align content with campaigns and launches
  • Maintain documentation of content workflows, AI prompts, and systems for scale and consistency
  • Stay ahead of content trends, AI capabilities, and automation use cases in marketing
  • Perform other duties as assigned

You Have:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field, or equivalent experience
  • Proven experience managing content in a digital marketing or eCommerce environment
  • Strong understanding of generative AI and hands-on experience using tools like ChatGPT or Claude
  • Experience using Make.com, n8n, or Lindy to build content automation workflows
  • Excellent writing and editing skills with a sharp eye for tone, clarity, and brand alignment
  • Deep understanding of SEO and keyword strategy
  • Experience managing social calendars, newsletters, and blog content pipelines
  • Comfort with CMS platforms (WordPress, Contentful, etc.) and email tools (HubSpot, Mailchimp, etc.)
  • A systems-thinking mindset and strong project management skills

Our awesome perks!

  • Remote company - work from anywhere
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Maternity/Paternity leave
  • Medical/Dental/Vision/FSA/Life
  • 401k with company match; vested immediately
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Inspiring & collaborative peer

The salary range for this position is $80k - $90k annually. This information is current as of the initial date of this job posting and may be modified in the future. The actual pay determined for an individual will vary based on job-related factors such as relevant experience and/or education, particular skills, and location.

Miva is a fully remote company with employees distributed across the U.S. Our ideal candidate for this role will reside in one of the following states: AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, ID, IL, KS, MA, MI, MO, NC, NH, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OR, PA, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, or WA.

Miva is a leading eCommerce software dedicated to empowering enterprise merchants and agencies with a state-of-the-art online storefront. To date, Miva software has powered over $100 billion in online sales for retailers worldwide.

Our success and the success of our clients are driven by high-performing teams of talented professionals. By creating a culture in which passion, ingenuity, and collaboration are rewarded, we have become the driving force for the advancement of independent commerce.

Miva is backed by Equality Asset Management, a private equity firm who is committed to supporting Company growth.

Miva has been named a Best and Brightest Company in 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024.

Miva, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Read Miva's Applicant Privacy Notice Here.

json.companyDescription:
Miva, Inc. is a leading provider of enterprise-level e-commerce solutions, empowering businesses to drive higher conversions, seamless integrations, and a reduced total cost of ownership. Our robust, scalable platform supports omnichannel retail strategies, making it the trusted choice for thousands of businesses across diverse industries, including B2B, DTC, and wholesale e-commerce.

With more than 20 years of experience and over $100 billion in transactions processed, Miva is renowned for delivering cutting-edge e-commerce solutions that meet the evolving demands of the market. Recently named one of the Best Places to Work in San Diego for the fourth consecutive year, Miva fosters a collaborative and dynamic workplace, where innovation and creativity are at the forefront. Our team includes top-tier professionals across e-commerce development, design, and marketing, all working together to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in e-commerce.

We specialize in providing customized solutions for online sellers, integrating with major platforms like Amazon, and offering advanced tools for inventory management, analytics, and SEO optimization. Miva is the go-to platform for businesses aiming to scale their e-commerce operations, offering a fully customizable, secure, and reliable solution to power their growth.

Ready to transform your online business with an e-commerce platform that adapts to your unique needs? Visit us at miva.com/company to learn more about how Miva can help you succeed in the competitive world of online retail.

json.title: Sr. Automation Engineer, UI Quality Assurance (Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
Machinify is the leading provider of AI-powered software products that transform healthcare claims and payment operations. Each year, the healthcare industry generates over $200B in claims mispayments, creating incredible waste, friction and frustration for all participants: patients, providers, and especially payers. Machinify‚Äôs revolutionary AI-platform has enabled the company to develop and deploy, at light speed, industry-specific products that increase the speed and accuracy of claims processing by orders of magnitude.

Machinify is seeking a UI focused Sr. Quality Assurance Automation Engineer to design, develop, and improve automation tools and tests.

The ideal background will have a focus on testing front-end web applications, developing manual and automated tests, and an interest in joining a product focused team. You are driven and scrappy when delivering tests that assess the quality of complex UI systems.

We're the Healthcare industry‚Äôs most comprehensive application suite. Our teams are highly collaborative across all areas of the organization, autonomous in their ability to perform work, and highly impactful towards the success of the business.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Work with Product Manager, Design team, and Engineers to clearly understand testing requirements and procedures
  • Design, develop, and run manual & automated tests to validate functionality of our core applications
  • Drive quality testing initiatives, analyze functionality of application, and continuously identify areas of improvement within our test automation suite
  • Develop test cases, document quality issues, and create testing reports
  • Create and maintain test data across test environments
  • Collaborate effectively with a distributed and cross-functional team to resolve any open issues
  • Provide timely QA updates to project managers and team leads

What You Bring

  • 6+ years of experience as an Automation Engineer with expertise in UI and service layer testing
  • Experience programming with Javascript; other languages are a plus
  • Experienced with front-end testing frameworks preferably with Cypress or Playwright
  • Good knowledge and use of SQL
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Github actions or similar tools.
  • Familiar with Docker and Git.
  • Detailed knowledge of application functions, bug fixing, and testing protocols
  • Excellent communication, critical thinking, and analytical skills
  • You are self driven, motivated, and feel a sense of ownership
  • Ability to adapt to and manage competing priorities
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and taking the initiative when required
  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Healthcare domain knowledge is a plus

What We Offer

  • Work from anywhere in the US! Machinify is digital-first.
  • Flexible and trusting environment where you‚Äôll feel empowered to do your best work
  • Unlimited PTO, recharge days and one no-meetings day a week
  • Medical/Dental/Vision for employees & their families
  • Competitive salary, equity, 401(k) sponsorship
  • Generous Learning and Development Reimbursement policy

The salary for this position is based on an array of factors unique to each candidate: Such as years and depth of experience, set skills, certifications, etc. The base salary range dependent on leveling is between 155k-180k.

We are hiring for different levels, and our Recruiting team will let you know if you qualify for a different role/range. Salary is one component of the total compensation package, which includes meaningful equity, excellent healthcare, flexible time off, and other benefits and perks to meet the needs of each individual.

Equal Employment Opportunity at Machinify

Machinify is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its positions. Machinify believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

json.companySlogan: The Healthcare Intelligence Company

json.title: Social Media Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
As a Social Media Specialist at ActiveCampaign, you‚Äôll help shape how our brand shows up across digital channels, building deeper connections with customers and expanding our global reach. You‚Äôll support the social media presence for ActiveCampaign‚Äôs portfolio of brands ‚Äî including ActiveCampaign, Postmark, and ACHQ ‚Äî through thoughtful content execution, community engagement, and creative storytelling.

In this role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with creative, content, product marketing, and product teams to bring platform-specific strategies to life, while combining creativity with data-driven insights to grow and energize our audiences. If you‚Äôre passionate about social storytelling, community-building, and brand expression ‚Äî this is the role for you.

What Your Day Could Consist Of

  • Content Execution: Support the publishing of social media content across LinkedIn, Instagram, X, Threads, Facebook, TikTok, and YouTube, ensuring posts are timely, accurate, and on-brand.
  • Creative Collaboration: Work with the creative, product marketing, and content teams to develop platform-specific visuals, short-form videos, and copy that resonate with each unique audience.
  • Community Engagement: Monitor and engage in conversations across platforms, amplifying customer stories, elevating brand sentiment, and identifying opportunities to connect authentically with our audiences.
  • Campaign Support: Partner with marketing and product teams to support launches, announcements, and broader campaigns with social-first executions.
  • Global Adaptation: Help adapt and tailor content for international audiences while maintaining consistency in brand voice and quality.
  • Idea Generation: Contribute creative ideas to grow our brand following, boost engagement, and deepen customer loyalty across social channels.
  • Performance Tracking: Assist in tracking, measuring, and analyzing social media performance metrics, helping to inform strategy and optimize future content.
  • Learning & Growth: Stay curious, actively learning best practices for social-first storytelling, trend spotting, and cross-channel campaign execution.

What Is Needed

  • 2+ years of experience in social media marketing, content creation, or a related digital marketing role.
  • A strong understanding of how content performs across different social platforms and how to optimize for audience engagement.
  • Previous experience in B2B, SaaS, or martech industries (a plus, but not required).
  • Excellent writing skills and a keen eye for voice, tone, and storytelling.
  • Familiarity with tools like Sprout Social, Canva, Figma, or video editing platforms (experience with scheduling and reporting tools a bonus).
  • A collaborative spirit with a proactive, creative, and data-informed approach to social media strategy.
  • Comfort engaging on social platforms during off-hours for urgent moments, product launches, or brand milestones when needed.
  • A passion for social media, digital storytelling, and building community through authentic brand expression.

About ActiveCampaign

ActiveCampaign is an AI-first, end-to-end marketing platform for people at the heart of the action. It empowers teams to automate their campaigns with AI agents that imagine, activate, and validate‚Äìfreeing them from step-by-step workflows and unlocking limitless ways to orchestrate their marketing.

With AI, goal-based automation, and 950+ app integrations, agencies, marketers, and owners can build cross-channel campaigns in minutes‚Äìfine-tuned with billions of data points to drive real results for their unique business.

ActiveCampaign is the trusted choice to help businesses unlock a new world of boundless opportunities‚Äìwhere ideas become impact and potential turns into real results.

As a global multicultural company, we are proud of our inclusive culture which embraces diverse voices, backgrounds, and perspectives. We don‚Äôt just celebrate our differences, we believe our diversity is what empowers our innovation and success. You can find out more about our DEI initiatives here.

Perks And Benefits

ActiveCampaign is an employee-first culture. We take care of our employees at work and outside of work. You can see more of the details here, but some of our most popular benefits include:

  • Comprehensive health and wellness benefits that includes a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) fully covered by ActiveCampaign, complimentary access to telehealth and tele-mental health resources, and a complimentary membership to Calm
  • Open paid time off
  • Generous 401(k) matching program with immediate vesting
  • Quarterly Path Perks with options for commuter and lunch benefits (for those reporting to a Hub), or a remote home office stipend
  • Access to professional development resources through LinkedIn Learning
  • After five years of service, you‚Äôll be eligible for a four-week paid sabbatical leave and a sabbatical leave bonus

ActiveCampaign is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, grow and promote no matter of gender, race, color, sexual orientation, religion, age, protected veteran status, physical and mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.

Our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) strive to foster a diverse inclusive environment by supporting each other, building a strong sense of belonging, and creating opportunities for mentorship and professional growth for their members.

Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base rate only and do not include bonus, equity, sales incentives or other role specific compensation that the role may be eligible for. ActiveCampaign believes in and is committed to equitable compensation practices. The salary range provided above is a good faith estimate of the pay range determined by the location associated with the job posting. The actual salary depends on a candidate‚Äôs skills, experience, and work location.

to support launches, announcements, and broader campaigns with social-first executions.Global Adaptation: Help adapt and tailor content for international audiences while maintaining consistency in brand voice and quality.Idea Generation: Contribute creative ideas to grow our brand following, boost engagement, and deepen customer loyalty across social channels.Performance Tracking: Assist in tracking, measuring, and analyzing social media performance metrics, helping to inform strategy and optimize future content.Learning & Growth: Stay curious, actively learning best practices for social-first storytelling, trend spotting, and cross-channel campaign execution.What Is Needed2+ years of experience in social media marketing, content creation, or a related digital marketing role.A strong understanding of how content performs across different social platforms and how to optimize for audience engagement.Previous experience in B2B, SaaS, or martech industries (a plus, but not required).Excellent writing skills and a keen eye for voice, tone, and storytelling.Familiarity with tools like Sprout Social, Canva, Figma, or video editing platforms (experience with scheduling and reporting tools a bonus).A collaborative spirit with a proactive, creative, and data-informed approach to social media strategy.Comfort engaging on social platforms during off-hours for urgent moments, product launches, or brand milestones when needed.A passion for social media, digital storytelling, and building community through authentic brand expression.About ActiveCampaignActiveCampaign is an AI-first, end-to-end marketing platform for people at the heart of the action. It empowers teams to automate their campaigns with AI agents that imagine, activate, and validate‚Äìfreeing them from step-by-step workflows and unlocking limitless ways to orchestrate their marketing.With AI, goal-based automation, and 950+ app integrations, agencies, marketers, and owners can build cross-channel campaigns in minutes‚Äìfine-tuned with billions of data points to drive real results for their unique business.ActiveCampaign is the trusted choice to help businesses unlock a new world of boundless opportunities‚Äìwhere ideas become impact and potential turns into real results.As a global multicultural company, we are proud of our inclusive culture which embraces diverse voices, backgrounds, and perspectives. We don‚Äôt just celebrate our differences, we believe our diversity is what empowers our innovation and success. You can find out more about our DEI initiatives here.Perks And BenefitsActiveCampaign is an employee-first culture. We take care of our employees at work and outside of work. You can see more of the details here, but some of our most popular benefits include:Comprehensive health and wellness benefits that includes a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) fully covered by ActiveCampaign, complimentary access to telehealth and tele-mental health resources, and a complimentary membership to CalmOpen paid time offGenerous 401(k) matching program with immediate vestingQuarterly Path Perks with options for commuter and lunch benefits (for those reporting to a Hub), or a remote home office stipendAccess to professional development resources through LinkedIn LearningAfter five years of service, you‚Äôll be eligible for a four-week paid sabbatical leave and a sabbatical leave bonusActiveCampaign is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, grow and promote no matter of gender, race, color, sexual orientation, religion, age, protected veteran status, physical and mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.Our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) strive to foster a diverse inclusive environment by supporting each other, building a strong sense of belonging, and creating opportunities for mentorship and professional growth for their members.Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base rate only and do not include bonus, equity, sales incentives or other role specific compensation that the role may be eligible for. ActiveCampaign believes in and is committed to equitable compensation practices. The salary range provided above is a good faith estimate of the pay range determined by the location associated with the job posting. The actual salary depends on a candidate‚Äôs skills, experience, and work location.

It‚Äôs the way marketing automation should be. Trusted by 180,000+ customers worldwide.
json.companySlogan: Turn your ideas into impact without the busywork. The way marketing automation should be.

json.title: Data and AI Operations Senior Director
json.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

Ontic makes software that corporate and government security professionals use to proactively manage threats, mitigate risks, and make businesses stronger. Built by security and software professionals, the Ontic Platform connects and unifies critical data, business processes, and collaborators in one place, consolidating security intelligence and operations. We call this Connected Intelligence. Ontic serves corporate security teams across key functions, including intelligence, investigations, GSOC, executive protection, and security operations.

As Ontic employees, we put our mission first and value the trust bestowed upon us by our clients to help keep their people safe. We approach our clients and each other with empathy while focusing on the execution of our strategy. And we have fun doing it.

Who You Are

Ontic is looking for a visionary and results-driven Data + AI Operations Leader to own data-driven decision-making and AI innovation across our organization. This individual will be responsible for Ontic‚Äôs GTM tool strategy, the orchestration of data & advanced analytics strategies, and the implementation & advancement of AI utilization.

Reporting into a team led by our VP of RevOps, which sits as an independent operational org reporting to our COO, and operating as a strategic business partner to GTM teams, you will work directly with our C-Suite & Senior Leadership Teams helping to drive tool, data, analytics, and AI strategy, ensuring key objectives and priorities are met across the company. The ideal candidate combines strategic thinking, technical expertise, and leadership skills to spearhead initiatives that transform data into actionable insights and intelligent automation in a scalable way.

Responsibilities

  • Drive cross-functional alignment with key organizations like Sales, Marketing, Client Success, Services, Engineering and Product to enable successful end-to-end execution of key data & AI initiatives
    • Advise and influence senior leaders on key business decisions required & major change initiatives
    • Define and lead the enterprise-wide analytics and AI strategy aligned with business objectives
    • Evangelize data-driven culture across departments and executive leadership
    • Collaborate with leaders to identify AI & analytics opportunities & prioritize high-impact projects
    • Translate business needs into technical requirements & actionable insights
  • Technology & Tools
    • Evaluate and implement data platforms, BI tools, and AI frameworks
    • Maintain a strong understanding of current trends and advancements in analytics, machine learning, and AI technologies
  • Analytics & AI Development
    • Drive AI usage and innovation within the Operations team and across the organization
    • Oversee the development of predictive models and analytics use cases
    • Guide the implementation of AI/ML models in production environments
    • Ensure ethical and responsible AI usage, including bias detection and governance
  • Measurement & Optimization
    • Develop KPIs and dashboards to track the impact of analytics and AI initiatives
    • Continuously improve models and solutions based on feedback and performance metrics
  • Prepare executive-level reporting & presentations on business results & key trends to help the leadership team understand how we are tracking to our goals, where there is risk and where there are successes to be replicated
  • Build processes & maintain data to enable a single source of truth to all critical datapoints needed to provide critical business insights & measure performance
    • Ensure consistent definitions, calculations and use of critical metrics company-wide
    • Establish data governance policies, ensuring data is collected and processed accurately, and maintaining the integrity of data sources
Preferred Qualifications

  • 10+ years experience in Operations, BI, Analytics, Data Strategy, Business Transformation
  • Proven experience scaling & managing GTM technology platforms; current tech stack includes but is not limited to Salesforce, Clari, Domo, GuideCX, ZoomInfo, Google Office Suite, Slack
  • Track record of delivering enterprise-scale analytics or AI initiatives
  • Expertise in data science tools and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, DOMO)
  • Strong understanding of machine learning, natural language processing, and/or generative AI applications
  • Experience working with ambiguity and laser focused on delivering results; excellent analytical and decision-making skills
  • Ability to translate complex data into clear and concise reports
  • Strong leadership & team-building skills
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or related field

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Ontic we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Ontic prioritizes the full inclusion of qualified individuals, providing necessary accommodations for those with disabilities to perform essential job functions. If you need assistance during the application or interview process or job tasks, please contact us at recruitment@ontic.co or call (512) 572-7400

Ontic does not provide sponsorship for employment visas or work authorization for this role. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship, now or in the future

Ontic Benefits & Perks

Competitive Salary

Medical, Vision & Dental Benefits

401k

Stock Options

HSA Contribution

Learning Stipend

Flexible PTO Policy

Quarterly company ME (mental escape) days

Generous Parental Leave policy

Home Office Stipend

Mobile Phone Reimbursement

Home Internet Reimbursement for Remote Employees

Anniversary & Milestone Celebrations

Ontic is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a work environment that celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate against any individual based on race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors protected by applicable law.

All Ontic employees are expected to understand and adhere to all Ontic Security and Privacy related policies in order to protect Ontic data and our clients data.

Compensation Range: $210K - $220K

json.companyDescription:
Ontic is a leading global aerospace OEM, providing complex engineered parts and repair services for established aircraft in the defense and commercial market. 

Boasting a portfolio of 8,000+ top-level assemblies, we are proud to work with our customers around the globe, with our team of experts delivering a wide variety of critical technologies, including fuel measurement systems, as well as a range of avionics, cockpit instruments and controls.

With over 50 years of product manufacturing and aftermarket support experience, we have operations across North America, UK & Europe, and Asia providing strategic worldwide support to civil and defense customers when and where it is needed.

We are helping create a safer, more sustainable future for the aerospace sector, and being more than the sum of our parts, we make a positive difference to our people and to the communities we operate in.

Find our more, including our latest news, on our website: www.ontic.com
json.companySlogan: Leading global aerospace OEM, providing complex engineered parts & repair services in the defense and commercial market

json.title: Software Engineer, New Grad & Junior
json.descriptionHtml:
At Jobright, we help high-growth startups hire top talent for their key roles.


About Us

[Jobright.ai](http://jobright.ai/) is an AI-driven job search assistant built to help professionals land their dream roles faster. Backed by a team of ex-Google, Twitter, and Microsoft engineers, and featured in the OpenAI GPT Store, we empower thousands of users daily through automation, resume tailoring, and insider job insights.


What You'll Do

As a new grad software engineer, you'll join our small but high-performing engineering team to build and scale the core infrastructure that powers our AI products. You'll work closely with senior engineers and the founding team on projects that ship fast and make a real impact.


You'll:

  • Build backend services and APIs for data ingestion, job matching, and user automation
  • Write Python code to process large-scale datasets (MongoDB, Snowflake, Zilliz)
  • Develop tools that automate and optimize workflows for job seekers
  • Collaborate on cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure) and CI/CD workflows
  • Analyze product usage and improve features based on user feedback and growth data


You Might Be a Good Fit If You‚Ä¶

  • Recently graduated with a CS, EE, Math, or related technical degree
  • Have solid Python skills and familiarity with SQL
  • Are excited about fast-paced startup environments and building from 0‚Üí1
  • Care deeply about user experience and product impact
  • Have some familiarity (or strong interest) in generative AI, cloud infra, or data pipelines
  • Bonus: Internship or project experience using MongoDB, Snowflake, or job-related platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Greenhouse)


Why Join Us

  • Work directly with a world-class team on a mission to democratize career success
  • Own meaningful projects from day one
  • Flexible hours, async culture, and remote-first
  • Fast growth: Jobright has grown 10x in the past year, with 40k+ daily users and viral reach on platforms like LinkedIn

we‚Äôre working with a lean early-stage ai startup building collaborative agent workflows, and they‚Äôre looking for a growth operator to help scale users and optimize every part of the funnel. this is a chance to join a product-led team early and directly shape how the company grows.
