json.title: Director of Revenue Operations
json.descriptionHtml:
About Us

AtCrescendo, we‚Äôre transforming customer experience with Augmented AI‚Äîa seamless blend of human expertise and AI automation that delivers better, faster, more scalable support. We‚Äôre not just changing how support works. We‚Äôre reshaping the economics of an entire industry.

The Role

Crescendo is seeking a strategic and execution-driven Director of Revenue Operations to lead the operational heartbeat of our go-to-market engine. This pivotal role will architect the systems, insights, and rhythms that accelerate revenue growth, enhance sales productivity, and align cross-functional teams in support of our enterprise customer base.

As a senior partner to Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Executive Leadership, you will build and operationalize a high-performance, data-informed revenue strategy that scales with Crescendo‚Äôs ambitious growth trajectory. You will drive transparency, accountability, and precision across pipeline generation, forecast accuracy, and customer lifecycle performance.

This is an ideal opportunity for a revenue leader who thrives at the intersection of strategy, systems, and scale‚Äîand who sees operations as a strategic lever for accelerating impact across the entire customer journey.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Strategic Revenue Enablement

  • Own the development and execution of Crescendo‚Äôs end-to-end revenue operations strategy‚Äîdriving alignment, efficiency, and clarity across all GTM functions
  • Partner with executive leadership to establish and operationalize revenue goals, annual planning cycles, and GTM OKRs
  • Build scalable frameworks for pipeline development, account segmentation, territory planning, and performance visibility
  • Design and facilitate executive reporting, business reviews, and operational cadences that enable proactive, data-driven decisions

Sales Operations & GTM Alignment

  • Serve as a trusted partner to Sales and Marketing leadership, ensuring full-funnel visibility and cross-functional cohesion from lead generation through renewal
  • Implement best-in-class tools, attribution models, and analytics to inform GTM strategy and optimize conversion at every stage of the buyer journey
  • Elevate seller productivity through enablement, territory design, quota setting, and compensation strategy
  • Act as a central source of truth on pipeline health, forecast accuracy, and revenue performance

Customer Lifecycle & Post-Sales Insight

  • Support the full customer lifecycle in partnership with Customer Success, Delivery, and Professional Services‚Äîaligning operational processes to customer value realization
  • Develop frameworks and metrics to track customer health, project outcomes, services profitability, and expansion potential
  • Enable seamless post-sale handoffs, consistent delivery methodology, and pricing strategies that reflect both value and scale
  • Support AI-managed services go-to-market plays by connecting product delivery models with operational performance insights

Systems, Tools & Infrastructure

  • Lead the selection, deployment, and optimization of key revenue systems including CRM, marketing automation, forecasting tools, and business intelligence platforms
  • Drive data integrity, process automation, and workflow efficiency across the GTM tech stack
  • Establish templates, playbooks, and dashboards that elevate visibility and streamline collaboration across functions

Forecasting, Analytics & Commercial Intelligence

  • Own revenue forecasting, scenario modeling, and pipeline analytics in partnership with Finance and Sales
  • Deliver insights and recommendations that inform strategic planning, resource allocation, and market expansion
  • Translate data into actionable narratives that drive accountability and inform growth levers

Team Development & Leadership

  • Build and mentor a high-performing RevOps team, instilling a culture of excellence, ownership, and continuous learning
  • Serve as a champion for Crescendo‚Äôs values‚Äîfostering collaboration, curiosity, and operational discipline across the GTM org
  • Collaborate with peers across Legal, Product, and Engineering to ensure alignment between customer insights, operational capabilities, and business outcomes

What We Expect From You:

Experience & Expertise

  • 10+ years of experience in Revenue Operations, Sales Strategy, or GTM leadership‚Äîpreferably within SaaS or AI-powered technology companies
  • Proven success driving measurable revenue growth through operational strategy, process design, and cross-functional alignment
  • Deep fluency in CRM platforms such as Hubspot, SalesNav, Gong (Record and Engage) are a must. Clay, Octave, any forecasting/data tools are a plus
  • Track record of partnering with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to drive holistic customer growth and lifecycle performance

Strategic Mindset & Operational Rigor

  • Strong analytical and forecasting skills with an ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
  • Comfortable owning executive-level reporting, revenue modeling, and strategic recommendations in fast-paced, high-growth environments
  • Adept at balancing long-term scalability with near-term impact

Leadership & Collaboration

  • Experience leading and scaling high-impact teams in a matrixed organization
  • Natural collaborator and communicator, with strong executive presence and the ability to influence across all levels
  • Passion for mentoring talent and elevating operational excellence across the organization

AI & Market Acumen

  • Familiarity with AI-powered product and service models, particularly in regulated sectors (e.g., FinTech, HealthTech, eCommerce)
  • Understanding of data governance, digital delivery, and evolving customer expectations in high-stakes industries is a plus

What You‚Äôll Get In Return:

  • Remote working arrangements
  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Generous paid vacation
  • Attractive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision options that are applicable per country of residence for all our full-time employees
  • Training opportunities provided by Crescendo and outside entities
  • 1-on-1 coaching with feedback sessions, mentorship, and opportunities for cross-functional development

Why Crescendo?

  • We‚Äôre creating a new category: Augmented AI
  • Our growth has been explosive‚Äî0 to $100M+ in ARR in under a year‚Äîand we‚Äôre just getting started
  • Our model is built on outcomes, not buzzwords. That means we only win when our customers do
  • You‚Äôll join a high-performing, customer-obsessed team that values speed, creativity, and craft
  • We‚Äôre remote-first, people-first, and purpose-driven

Join us and help shape the future of customer experience.

Company Culture Is At Our Core

Our core values bring intention to our work and set the tone for our culture. From the partners we serve to the associates who work with us, we share a set of core values that guide our actions.

  • Care for others - Cooperate, empathize, and seek opportunities to put each other first
  • Embrace growth - Expand your mind by taking calculated risks, developing your skills, and staying open to change
  • Manifest trust - Trust is the bond that allows us to work at our highest levels, as members of a team, in a unified direction. It is continuously earned by delivering on our commitments
  • Take ownership - Doing the right thing should come naturally
  • Be humble - Seek guidance, receive feedback, ask questions, and listen to your colleagues

Crescendo is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We value diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging and these pillars are at the heart of how we work together. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We are committed to the inclusion of all individuals and will make reasonable accommodations‚ÄØfor qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. ‚ÄØIf you require assistance or accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please contactcareers@crescendo.ai.

There‚Äôs huge potential in the new chapter of AI-powered customer service. But it will only be captured by companies that can shake up the industry models that hold back innovation.

We‚Äôre a group of founders who have worked in customer experience for years. Our tech and our people have served billions of customers and provided exceptional service across the world.

We‚Äôre combining the most advanced AI technology with the best human agents to provide a blended experience. With everything orchestrated together, we can dramatically accelerate improvements to agent and customer experience.

That means customer service that‚Äôs more in sync, easier to manage, and more tightly integrated than ever before.

And our customers will only pay for positive outcomes. It‚Äôs a brilliant harmony of AI and CX.

json.title: RPA Developer II
json.descriptionHtml:
As a leading regional bank, SouthState has been providing financial solutions to individuals, families, and businesses in the Southeast for more than 100 years. SouthState team members strive to create remarkable experiences while building meaningful and lasting relationships. We are proud to be a reflection of the communities we serve, and our team members share core values that make SouthState a great place to bank, and a great place to work.


Summary/Objectives

Driving efficiency through automation is a strategic initiative, and the RPA Developer is responsible for executing on that front. As part of an ongoing digital transformation, RPA plays a critical role in driving scalability within our core banking platform and third-party providers.

Solution design, workflow orchestration, and adherence to Agile / SCRUM methodologies are all essential in the execution of the RPA Developer‚Äôs duties. The RPA Developer will be expected to maintain effective communication with lines of business and third-party partners, while developing meaningful solutions that increase efficiency and reduce costs. This is a fully remote position based in Florida, Alabama, Georgia, Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, South Carolina, Virginia, Tennessee, or Virginia.


Essential Functions

  • Strong understanding and implementation of best practice RPA design patterns
  • Mentor junior staff and work closely with systems support staff.
  • Design, develop, and configure complex Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software systems to meet business process and application requirements
  • Facilitating process evaluation and solution design
  • Design reusable custom activities to reduce repetitive efforts and streamline workflows
  • Facilitate testing and implementation that is compliant with internal change management
  • Maintain separation between testing, UAT, and production environments
  • Translate business requirements into effective workflows
  • Ability to design solutions with flexibility around changing business needs and requirements
  • Effective time management and forecasting for planning and meeting deadlines
  • Familiarity with Agile / SCRUM methodologies


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


COMPETENCIES

  • Experience with Microsoft .NET Framework
  • Proficiency in programing languages such as VB.NET, C#
  • RPA Platform Experience (UiPath and Nintex Preferred)
  • Experience with UiPath both on-prem and cloud
  • Experience with defining standards for scaling automation environments
  • Experience with implementing end-to-end execution of various processes using attended and unattended bots
  • Experience with SQL or other relational databases and/or document stores
  • Experience with REST API‚Äôs
  • Experience with version control system (Git and GitHub)
  • Knowledge of applying AI Framework such as Document Understanding, Computer Vision to automation workflows
  • Experience with core banking integrations (Fiserv Premier preferred)
  • Understanding of requirements and partnering with lines of business to implement them
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills


Qualifications, Education, And Certification Requirements

  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science or related degree-preferred but not required
  • Experience: 3.5+ years in general software development with experience in complex automation
  • Certifications/Specific Knowledge:


Recommended Additional Training

  • New employee orientation
  • Required annual compliance training
  • UiPath RPA Developer Training Curriculum / Certification


PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, & reports. This position requires a large amount of time in front of a computer. This can be done sitting or standing with use of the right desk.


WORK ENVIRONMENT

Telecommuting roles no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. They must also have a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered. Travel may be required to come to meetings as needed.

In accordance with Colorado law: Colorado pay for this position is anticipated to be between $74,400.00 - $118,848.00 , actual offers to be determined based on applicant‚Äôs skills, experience and education.

While the anticipated deadline for the job posting is 06-19-2025, we encourage you to submit your application as we may still consider qualified candidates beyond this date.

Benefits | SouthState Careers

json.companyDescription:
The SouthState story is one of steady growth, deep community roots, and an unwavering commitment to helping our customers move forward. Since our beginnings in the 1930s to becoming a trusted financial partner across the South and beyond ‚Äî we are known for combining  personal relationships with forward-thinking solutions.
 
As we grow, our experienced bankers are committed to helping our customers find their success while maintaining the integrity of our values: building trust, fostering lasting relationships, and helping communities and businesses thrive.   

This is SouthState. This is Banking Forward. 

Member FDIC and Equal Housing Lender.

json.title: Product Designer (EST - NAMER or LATAM)
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Role

This role can be located in the following countries: US, Canada, Argentina, Brazil, or Colombia.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled and experienced Product Designer to join our team. If you're excited about shaping the future of workforce upskilling ‚Äî by designing thoughtful, AI-powered experiences that make complex tasks feel intuitive ‚Äî this could be your next great adventure!

At Workera, we believe design is central to building exceptional products. You‚Äôll partner closely with product managers, engineers, and other designers to craft interfaces that are not only visually compelling, but also rooted in user needs, data insights, and strategic priorities.

To support this, we work in small, nimble project teams (2‚Äì3 people) using the ShapeUp methodology. Each team spends six weeks deeply focused on solving a specific business problem. As the designer on your team, you‚Äôll help shape the problem space, wireframe and prototype solutions, and bring interfaces to life ‚Äî all while championing the voice of the user.

You‚Äôll also serve as a key thought partner to product and engineering leads, helping to balance functionality with simplicity, and ensuring our AI-native platform feels both powerful and human-centered.

About Your Team

We're looking for a Product Designer to lead the design of admin and analytics experiences that power our skill development platform. You'll focus on creating intuitive workflows for program creation, user enrollment, license management, and HR tech integrations (e.g., Workday). You'll also design analytics tools that surface insights like skill readiness, program progress, and employee engagement. This role requires strong systems thinking, attention to detail, and a passion for making complex data and admin tasks simple and actionable.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Contribute to overall strategy and decision-making about product direction.
  • Collaborate with a product manager and engineering manager to conduct research into customer goals and challenges.
  • Use qualitative and quantitative data to validate design decisions, and contribute to a library of insights to evangelize customer needs across the org.
  • Shape customer problems and opportunities by refining insights and wireframing new experiences; rapidly iterate via low-fidelity prototypes.
  • Partner closely with engineers to evolve solutions from rough concepts to polished, high-fidelity interfaces and experiences.
  • Experiment with the latest generative AI technologies to design intuitive experiences that make the most of Workera‚Äôs AI-native capabilities.
  • Design agentic AI workflows that balance automation with user control‚Äîensuring AI output is observable, correctable, and aligned with human goals.
  • Collaborate with product design teammates to ensure a consistent, quality experience across the platform.
  • Use, contribute to, and help evolve Workera‚Äôs design system and visual language.
  • Please note as we are a dynamic and quickly growing scale-up, things are always subject to change*

What You‚Äôll Bring

  • 2-5 years designing digital products (UX + UI)
  • Experience designing SaaS solutions
  • Experience with design systems and strong system-level thinking
  • Ability to design simple solutions to complex user problems
  • Humility and willingness to act on design feedback in an iterative process
  • Proficiency in utilizing AI tools such as ChatGPT or equivalent digital assistants and applying them effectively within your work context.

Nice To Have

  • Familiarity with the corporate skills development industry
  • Understanding or experience with designing human-in-the-loop or AI agent interfaces

About Workera

Workera is a fast-growing, Series B Silicon Valley start-up redefining how enterprises understand, develop, and mobilize talent. Workera‚Äôs skills intelligence platform empowers leaders to make better, more informed talent development decisions. Utilizing computational psychometrics, machine learning, and AI technologies, Workera delivers best-in-class computer adaptive assessments with hyper-personalized learning plans to global companies across all industries. Our clients include Samsung, Siemens Energy, and the US Air Force.

Our founder is Kian Katanforoosh, an award-winning Stanford Computer Science Lecturer who has taught AI to over 1 million people, and our Chairman is Dr. Andrew Ng, co-founder of Coursera (NYSE: COUR), CEO of DeepLearning.AI, and founding lead of the Google Brain project.

We‚Äôre learners, dreamers, and game-changers. Join us.

At Workera, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Workera believes that diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the best and most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Selection for employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

json.companyDescription:
Workera is the skills intelligence platform redefining how enterprises understand, develop, and mobilize talent.

We empower organizations to stay ahead by unlocking the skills data needed to drive innovation and data-driven talent strategies across precision upskilling, talent acquisition, talent mobility, and coaching & mentoring.

Enterprises get an objective pulse of their innovation skills through our configurable skills ontology and AI-powered measurement of skills at an atomic-level. 

We focus on innovation skills for all levels across over 100 domains, including data, AI, software, cloud, and cyber.
json.companySlogan: Workera is the skills intelligence platform redefining how enterprises understand, develop, and mobilize talent.

json.title: Software Engineer, GTM AI
json.descriptionHtml:
About DroneDeploy

Build with certainty, operate with confidence. That‚Äôs why thousands of construction, oil and gas, and renewable energy companies use DroneDeploy on a daily basis. We help them automate reality capture using drones, robots, and 360 cameras ‚Äì combining this data in one platform for AI-powered analysis. From aerial and ground views of construction progress to automated gauge readings and methane leak detection, DroneDeploy is shaping the future of reality capture.

At DroneDeploy, we thrive in a remote-first culture, powered by innovation. Growth is limitless, and employee contributions matter. With accolades as a Best Place to Work in the SF Bay Area and a spot on America‚Äôs Best Startups list, our team is dynamic, purpose-driven, and dedicated to delivering top-tier reality capture software. We cultivate an environment of opportunity. Our dynamic growth is fueled by the diverse range of ideas nurtured by our team. This is why our commitment to internal advancement is profound. A multitude of paths for professional and personal development are available, where flexible schedules, family-friendly benefits, and remote work options propel our team's journey.

About the Role:

We‚Äôre looking for a high-performing engineer with prior work experience in Sales/Marketing‚Äî ideally someone who started their career in Sales Ops, Marketing Ops, or a Sales/Marketing role at a B2B SaaS business, and then transitioned into engineering. You‚Äôve already learned how to work in a fast-paced environment, how a SaaS Go To Market motion works and now you want to apply your Engineering skills to build scalable tools using AI, automation, and modern engineering practices to drive efficiency and productivity in a modern GTM environment.

This role is designed for someone who can hit the ground running: writing clean code, collaborating across teams, and delivering production-level tools. They‚Äôre willing to talk to end-users, do lightweight design, full-stack development and get energized by driving impact through deployed and used code.

You‚Äôll be reporting to the co-founder and collaborating with GTM leadership on high-impact projects that will drive sales efficiency across the business using cutting edge technologies and ideas.

Work Environment:

> Work Hours: Be available during Monday - Friday, 9am time to 3pm Pacific Time for team meetings and collaboration (feel free to extend normal work day on either end).

> Work Model: 100% remote okay, open to a Hybrid model in the SF Bay Area (2 - 3 days in person) if in the area and interested.

> Work Travel: No travel requirements, but some company gatherings would be available and appreciated if you could join.

Responsibilities:

  • Build internal and customer/prospect facing tools to help accelerate our GTM motion using AI.
  • Work with stakeholders across GTM teams (Sales, Marketing, CS, Support, RevOps) to understand needs and rapidly prototype solutions.
  • Work with Marketing Ops, Sales Ops and Enablement to deploy, measure the impact of, and refine approaches based on pre-defined metrics.
  • Quickly iterate on tools based on end-user feedback and usage/utilization.
  • Apply software development best practices, design patterns, and testing frameworks.
  • Create reusable code libraries/MCP servers to enable consumption of new tools in a variety of places (creating a library of internal AI enrichment tooling).
  • Common tech stack would be:
  • Backend (Python): FastAPI/Flask, SQLAlchemy, Pandas, Pydantic
  • Frontend (JS): React Typescript, Tailwind, but JS/CSS is totally fine
  • APIs: OpenAI, Anthropic, VertexAI, Perplexity, MCP, Salesforce, Clay, Outreach, Slack, Twillio etc..
  • Collaborate with the Data & Analytics team to pull customer usage/engagement data and leverage in tooling.
  • Creating documentation and ‚Äòrun-books‚Äô for productionized solutions so others can debug if things go wrong.


Requirements:

  • Former GTM Professional (2+ years in Sales Ops, Marketing Ops, RevOps, Sales or Marketing) prior to transitioning to software engineering (prior experience building tools for Sales/Marketing also okay).
  • Proficiency in Python and JavaScript, with experience in both frontend and backend development.
  • Familiarity with AI tools via APIs (no need to know how to train/fine-tune/RL models).
  • Awareness of and curiosity about the AI Landscape (different models/paradigms, tools being used the wild).
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment.
  • Strong understanding of engineering principles, version control, and modern tooling.
  • Good communication skills, and excited to hear from end-users on what‚Äôs working and what‚Äôs not.
  • A builder‚Äôs mindset with a bias toward action and experimentation.


Remote

Employee Offerings & Benefits

(Varies by location and position)

These are just some of the benefits we offer‚Äîexplore more when you join us!

> Innovative Company Culture ‚Äì Thrive in an environment that encourages creativity and collaboration.

> Drone Pilot Certification ‚Äì Get certified and develop unique skills with our support.

> Flexible Work Options ‚Äì Enjoy flexibility with both your schedule and work location.

> Family Paid Leave ‚Äì Supporting you and your family when it matters most.

> Top-Tier Healthcare Benefits ‚Äì Comprehensive health coverage designed to support your well-being.

> Professional Development & Career Growth ‚Äì Opportunities to advance and grow in your career.

> Flexible Paid Time Off ‚Äì Take the time you need to recharge and stay balanced.

> Employee Referral Bonus ‚Äì Help us grow the team and get rewarded for great referrals.

DroneDeploy is an equal opportunity employer.

All DroneDeploy employees are responsible for assisting in protecting the company and customer data by following information security policies and procedures.

Please refer to our Recruitment Privacy Notice for information about privacy during the recruiting process.

json.title: Senior Product Manager, AI Products
json.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

Ontic makes software that corporate and government security professionals use to proactively manage threats, mitigate risks, and make businesses stronger. Built by security and software professionals, the Ontic Platform connects and unifies critical data, business processes, and collaborators in one place, consolidating security intelligence and operations. We call this Connected Intelligence. Ontic serves corporate security teams across key functions, including intelligence, investigations, GSOC, executive protection, and security operations.

As Ontic employees, we put our mission first and value the trust bestowed upon us by our clients to help keep their people safe. We approach our clients and each other with empathy while focusing on the execution of our strategy. And we have fun doing it.

Who We Are

Ontic makes software that corporate and government security professionals use to proactively manage threats, mitigate risks, and make businesses stronger. Built by security and software professionals, the Ontic Platform connects and unifies critical data, business processes, and collaborators in one place, consolidating security intelligence and operations. We call this Connected Intelligence. Ontic serves corporate security teams across key functions, including intelligence, investigations, GSOC, executive protection, and security operations.

As Ontic employees, we put our mission first and value the trust bestowed upon us by our clients to help keep their people safe. We approach our clients and each other with empathy while focusing on the execution of our strategy. And we have fun doing it.

Who You Are

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate productivity, insight, and decision-making using the power of generative AI. Our platform leverages multiple data sources along with intelligent layers that integrate seamlessly with existing tools our clients use to enhance user experience, automate routine tasks, and unlock a single pane of glass in the Security space.As a Senior Product Manager ‚Äì AI Products, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in creating powerful AI capabilities, accelerating Ontic‚Äôs AI first approach through strategic roadmap and execution.

Responsibilities

  • Own the AI first roadmap: Drive the roadmap and execution of AI-powered interfaces and automation layers that sit atop existing systems and workflows.
  • Identify High-Impact Use Cases: Partner with clients, designers, and internal teams to uncover moments where generative AI can boost productivity, reduce friction, or automate decision-making.
  • Design End-to-End Experiences: Shape AI-driven user journeys‚Äîfrom prompts and natural language inputs to safe, explainable outputs.
  • Collaborate with AI/ML Teams: Work closely with prompt engineers, LLM researchers, and backend engineers to ensure seamless technical integration with foundational systems.
  • Prioritize Safely and Responsibly: Balance velocity with responsible AI practices, considering bias, hallucination risk, and transparency.
  • Define Success Metrics: Set and track success criteria across usability, adoption, engagement, and business impact.
  • Bridge the Gap: Translate between non-technical stakeholders and technical teams to ensure clarity and momentum in development

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5‚Äì8 years of product management experience, including at least 1‚Äì2 years in AI/ML product development
  • Experience building wrapper-style or augmentation-focused products (e.g., AI assistants, copilots, auto-summary tools)
  • Strong understanding of LLMs, prompt design, RAG (retrieval augmented generation), and vector embeddings
  • Comfort working with backend systems, APIs, and multi-system integrations
  • Obsession with UX simplicity, speed-to-value, and practical AI outcomes
  • Excellent communication and cross-functional leadership skills
  • Experience with open-source or commercial LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, etc.)
  • Knowledge of vector databases, orchestration frameworks (LangChain, Semantic Kernel), or agent frameworks
  • Exposure to enterprise workflows in Security verticalFamiliarity with regulatory considerations around AI/ML (e.g., GDPR, AI Act)

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Ontic we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Ontic prioritizes the full inclusion of qualified individuals, providing necessary accommodations for those with disabilities to perform essential job functions. If you need assistance during the application or interview process or job tasks, please contact us at recruitment@ontic.co or call (512) 572-7400

Ontic does not provide sponsorship for employment visas or work authorization for this role. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship, now or in the future

Ontic Benefits & Perks

Competitive Salary

Medical, Vision & Dental Benefits

401k

Stock Options

HSA Contribution

Learning Stipend

Flexible PTO Policy

Quarterly company ME (mental escape) days

Generous Parental Leave policy

Home Office Stipend

Mobile Phone Reimbursement

Home Internet Reimbursement for Remote Employees

Anniversary & Milestone Celebrations

Ontic is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a work environment that celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate against any individual based on race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors protected by applicable law.

All Ontic employees are expected to understand and adhere to all Ontic Security and Privacy related policies in order to protect Ontic data and our clients data.

Ontic Benefits & Perks

We do not discriminate against any individual based on race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors protected by applicable law.

All Ontic employees are expected to understand and adhere to all Ontic Security and Privacy related policies in order to protect Ontic data and our clients data.

Compensation Range: $170K - $180K

json.companyDescription:
Ontic is a leading global aerospace OEM, providing complex engineered parts and repair services for established aircraft in the defense and commercial market. 

Boasting a portfolio of 8,000+ top-level assemblies, we are proud to work with our customers around the globe, with our team of experts delivering a wide variety of critical technologies, including fuel measurement systems, as well as a range of avionics, cockpit instruments and controls.

With over 50 years of product manufacturing and aftermarket support experience, we have operations across North America, UK & Europe, and Asia providing strategic worldwide support to civil and defense customers when and where it is needed.

We are helping create a safer, more sustainable future for the aerospace sector, and being more than the sum of our parts, we make a positive difference to our people and to the communities we operate in.

Find our more, including our latest news, on our website: www.ontic.com
json.companySlogan: Leading global aerospace OEM, providing complex engineered parts & repair services in the defense and commercial market

json.title: Software Engineer, New Grad & Junior
json.descriptionHtml:
At Jobright, we help high-growth startups hire top talent for their key roles.


About Us

[Jobright.ai](http://jobright.ai/) is an AI-driven job search assistant built to help professionals land their dream roles faster. Backed by a team of ex-Google, Twitter, and Microsoft engineers, and featured in the OpenAI GPT Store, we empower thousands of users daily through automation, resume tailoring, and insider job insights.


What You'll Do

As a new grad software engineer, you'll join our small but high-performing engineering team to build and scale the core infrastructure that powers our AI products. You'll work closely with senior engineers and the founding team on projects that ship fast and make a real impact.


You'll:

  • Build backend services and APIs for data ingestion, job matching, and user automation
  • Write Python code to process large-scale datasets (MongoDB, Snowflake, Zilliz)
  • Develop tools that automate and optimize workflows for job seekers
  • Collaborate on cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure) and CI/CD workflows
  • Analyze product usage and improve features based on user feedback and growth data


You Might Be a Good Fit If You‚Ä¶

  • Recently graduated with a CS, EE, Math, or related technical degree
  • Have solid Python skills and familiarity with SQL
  • Are excited about fast-paced startup environments and building from 0‚Üí1
  • Care deeply about user experience and product impact
  • Have some familiarity (or strong interest) in generative AI, cloud infra, or data pipelines
  • Bonus: Internship or project experience using MongoDB, Snowflake, or job-related platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Greenhouse)


Why Join Us

  • Work directly with a world-class team on a mission to democratize career success
  • Own meaningful projects from day one
  • Flexible hours, async culture, and remote-first
  • Fast growth: Jobright has grown 10x in the past year, with 40k+ daily users and viral reach on platforms like LinkedIn

json.companySlogan: Your AI-Powered Job Search Co-Pilot

json.title: Senior Analyst, Marketing Strategy
json.descriptionHtml:
• Commercial strategist with technical depth: Builds models, wrangles data, and translates marketing performance into actionable investment insights.

  • Drives smarter, faster growth decisions by defining how Zip measures CAC, LTV, ROI, and scales what works.

  • Remote-first opportunity for US-based employees with the option to work in-person out of our Manhattan office 



 


Start your adventure with Zip 


We're looking for a Senior Analyst, Marketing Strategy & Analytics to help us unlock stronger economic returns from our marketing investments. This role sits at the intersection of data, strategy, and growth;  ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex problems and building the systems that turn insight into action.


You‚Äôll own the definition, modeling, and analysis of critical metrics like CAC, LTV, and ROI across our paid marketing channels. Your work will directly influence where and how we invest. You‚Äôll partner closely with Growth, Commercial Strategy, Product, and Data teams, serving as the connective tissue between raw data and real business decisions and embedding automation and AI along the way to increase speed and scale.


Interesting problems you‚Äôll get to solve




  • Build Zip‚Äôs next-gen marketing analytics foundation ‚Äî architecting the data models, metrics, and dashboards that define how we measure CAC, LTV, ROI, and payback across all paid media efforts.

  • Translate marketing performance into commercial insight, helping Zip quantify acquisition cost, marketing contribution to TTV/revenue, and the true return on ad spend across platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok.

  • Lead the end-to-end development of marketing dashboards in Tableau ‚Äî from sourcing raw data to designing metric logic to guiding implementation through technical and non-technical collaborators.

  • Partner with stakeholders across Marketing, Data, and Product to identify key data inputs, uncover gaps, and validate assumptions. You'll become the expert on what exists, what‚Äôs missing, and how to close those gaps.

  • Solve ambiguous, first-of-their-kind analytics problems ‚Äî using first-principles thinking to quantify outcomes, simulate trade-offs, and make recommendations even when the data is messy or incomplete.

  • Evaluate financing costs and downstream revenue implications of various acquisition strategies, surfacing insights that shape both day-to-day tactics and long-term investment decisions.

  • Bring a technical lens to the marketing analytics function, stitching together disparate data sources, building internal tooling, and using automation to increase the speed and quality of insights.

  • Embed AI tools and generative capabilities into your analytics workflow ‚Äî accelerating report generation, enhancing pattern recognition across campaigns, and reducing manual lift in dashboard upkeep and insight generation.

  • Act as a strategic advisor to Marketing and Commercial leaders, using data to clearly articulate what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs not, and where we should invest next.



What you‚Äôll bring to the team 




  • 5+ years of experience in Commercial Strategy, Marketing Analytics, or Commercial Analytics. Experience in MarTech, fin tech, big tech, management consulting, marketing agency a plus

  • Hands-on ownership of performance measurement frameworks, including defining and calculating CAC, LTV, and marketing ROI.

  • Strong modeling ability in Excel/Google Sheets, with comfort building from scratch and manipulating large datasets; Tableau, SQL, or PowerBI experience a plus.

  • Track record of influencing decisions through data, including partnering closely with Growth, Marketing, and Data teams to drive investment or campaign shifts.

  • Experience synthesizing complex, ambiguous data into clear business insights, with an emphasis on business value (e.g. cost savings, revenue efficiency).

  • Proactive problem-solving mindset, including the ability to operate autonomously and prioritize workstreams with minimal guidance.

  • Exposure to AI or automation in analytics workflows, or a strong interest in integrating modern tools to improve reporting efficiency.

  • Proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives & project manaage in matrixed environments

  • Demonstrated ownership mindset, applying First Principles thinking to break down ambiguous problems and deliver high-impact projects from concept to execution ‚Äî without waiting for a playbook.



What you‚Äôll get in return


Zip is a place where you‚Äôll get out what you put in. The newness of our sector means we need to move at pace and embrace change, and our promise to you when you join the team is that you‚Äôll feel empowered and trusted to make big things happen quickly. We want you to feel welcome and as though you have the support to be yourself, and care for yourself at work. Because it‚Äôs important to us that you make the most of the opportunities you‚Äôll get to grow your skills and your career, and be surrounded by smart, friendly people and leaders that have your back.


We think these are just some of the best things about being a Zipster. We will also offer you:




  • Flexible working culture

  • Incentive programs

  • 20 days PTO every year

  • Generous paid parental leave

  • Leading family support policies

  • 100% employer covered insurance

  • Beautiful Union Square office with a casual dress code

  • Learning and wellness subscription stipend

  • Company-sponsored 401k match



Zip is committed to a straightforward and transparent pay structure. The actual base salary will be determined by various individualized factors, including job-related knowledge, skills, experience, location, internal equity, as well as other objective business considerations. The annual base Pay Range for this position is $116,000 - $125,000 USD. This range reflects our US national compensation (USN). Additional premium percentages may apply based on our tiered premium strategy.


Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. 


If hired, employees will be in an 'at-will position' and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.


Be a part of a team that reflects the diversity of our customers


We pride ourselves on being a workplace that provides equal opportunities to people of all ages, cultural backgrounds, sexual orientations, gender identities, abilities, veteran status, and everything else that makes you unique. Equally, we‚Äôre committed to ensuring our recruitment processes are accessible and inclusive. Please let us know If there are any adjustments that need to be made to ensure you have a fair and equitable experience.


And finally‚Ä¶get to know us


Zip Co Limited (ASX: ZIP) is a digital financial services company, offering innovative, people-centered products.


Operating in two core markets - Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) and the US, Zip offers access to point-of-sale credit and digital payment services, connecting millions of customers with its global network of tens of thousands of merchants.


We‚Äôre proud to be a values-led business and our values - Customer First, Own it, Stronger Together and Change the Game - guide us in everything we do.


I acknowledge by clicking "Submit Application", that the information provided is true and correct. I also understand that any willful dishonesty may render for refusal of this application or immediate termination of employment. By providing your information, you acknowledge that you have read our Zip Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice and authorize Zip to process your data subject to those terms. Zip participates in the federal government‚Äôs E-Verify program


Before you apply, give Zip a try   -> rebrand.ly/check-zip-out
json.descriptionText: Commercial strategist with technical depth: Builds models, wrangles data, and translates marketing performance into actionable investment insights.Drives smarter, faster growth decisions by defining how Zip measures CAC, LTV, ROI, and scales what works.Remote-first opportunity for US-based employees with the option to work in-person out of our Manhattan office  Start your adventure with Zip We're looking for a Senior Analyst, Marketing Strategy & Analytics to help us unlock stronger economic returns from our marketing investments. This role sits at the intersection of data, strategy, and growth;  ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex problems and building the systems that turn insight into action.You‚Äôll own the definition, modeling, and analysis of critical metrics like CAC, LTV, and ROI across our paid marketing channels. Your work will directly influence where and how we invest. You‚Äôll partner closely with Growth, Commercial Strategy, Product, and Data teams, serving as the connective tissue between raw data and real business decisions and embedding automation and AI along the way to increase speed and scale.Interesting problems you‚Äôll get to solveBuild Zip‚Äôs next-gen marketing analytics foundation ‚Äî architecting the data models, metrics, and dashboards that define how we measure CAC, LTV, ROI, and payback across all paid media efforts.Translate marketing performance into commercial insight, helping Zip quantify acquisition cost, marketing contribution to TTV/revenue, and the true return on ad spend across platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok.Lead the end-to-end development of marketing dashboards in Tableau ‚Äî from sourcing raw data to designing metric logic to guiding implementation through technical and non-technical collaborators.Partner with stakeholders across Marketing, Data, and Product to identify key data inputs, uncover gaps, and validate assumptions. You'll become the expert on what exists, what‚Äôs missing, and how to close those gaps.Solve ambiguous, first-of-their-kind analytics problems ‚Äî using first-principles thinking to quantify outcomes, simulate trade-offs, and make recommendations even when the data is messy or incomplete.Evaluate financing costs and downstream revenue implications of various acquisition strategies, surfacing insights that shape both day-to-day tactics and long-term investment decisions.Bring a technical lens to the marketing analytics function, stitching together disparate data sources, building internal tooling, and using automation to increase the speed and quality of insights.Embed AI tools and generative capabilities into your analytics workflow ‚Äî accelerating report generation, enhancing pattern recognition across campaigns, and reducing manual lift in dashboard upkeep and insight generation.Act as a strategic advisor to Marketing and Commercial leaders, using data to clearly articulate what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs not, and where we should invest next.What you‚Äôll bring to the team 5+ years of experience in Commercial Strategy, Marketing Analytics, or Commercial Analytics. Experience in MarTech, fin tech, big tech, management consulting, marketing agency a plusHands-on ownership of performance measurement frameworks, including defining and calculating CAC, LTV, and marketing ROI.Strong modeling ability in Excel/Google Sheets, with comfort building from scratch and manipulating large datasets; Tableau, SQL, or PowerBI experience a plus.Track record of influencing decisions through data, including partnering closely with Growth, Marketing, and Data teams to drive investment or campaign shifts.Experience synthesizing complex, ambiguous data into clear business insights, with an emphasis on business value (e.g. cost savings, revenue efficiency).Proactive problem-solving mindset, including the ability to operate autonomously and prioritize workstreams with minimal guidance.Exposure to AI or automation in analytics workflows, or a strong interest in integrating modern tools to improve reporting efficiency.Proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives & project manaage in matrixed environmentsDemonstrated ownership mindset, applying First Principles thinking to break down ambiguous problems and deliver high-impact projects from concept to execution ‚Äî without waiting for a playbook.What you‚Äôll get in returnZip is a place where you‚Äôll get out what you put in. json.title: Customer Solutions Engineer - US-Based
json.descriptionHtml:
At Dexory, we‚Äôre redefining warehouse automation through AI, robotics and real-time data. As we rapidly scale to meet demand from leading global logistics and retail companies, we need a highly agile, resilient and strategic supply chain to support our growth. Our mission is to become the most dominant force in warehouse automation and that includes building world-class operational infrastructure behind the scenes.

Role:

This is a high impact role to help ensure customer growth and success. This is a multi-faceted role with elements of Sales Engineering and Robot Deployment/Support. This role requires a customer facing professional that can mix technical and commercial skill to drive market expansion of Dexory solutions. You will play a key part in helping to deliver our product into our customers‚Äô hands; working closely with the commercial and engineering teams to support the sales and integration process.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as the main North American customer contact for deployment and installation of our hardware and software platforms.
  • Work with customers to schedule delivery and installation of hardware and software products, including mechanical, electrical, software, and network services.
  • Take part in customer site visits to execute the installation process, including system setup, configuration, calibration, and troubleshooting.
  • Maintain and facilitate communication with customers to resolve any technical issues with their installation of deployment processes.
  • Coordinate technical sales activities for prospective accounts, performing both in-depth and high-level technical presentations for customers and prospects.
  • Support existing customer site operations on a day-to-day basis as required.
  • Serve as a point of contact for escalated technical issues.
  • Support warehouse mapping, preventative maintenance, and system upgrades.

About you:

  • Comfortable with working with large data sets as well as troubleshooting issues on hardware and software products.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts clearly and listen actively.
  • Adept at problem-solving, analytical thinking, and creative solutions.
  • Empathy and customer focus are crucial for understanding and meeting client needs.
  • Effective teamwork, interpersonal skills, and the ability to collaborate across departments are essential.
  • Understanding of Logistics and Ecommerce market a plus.
  • Experience with warehouse automation solutions, experience with WMS and related logistics business software a plus.
  • Competent with Google Suite and Microsoft Office.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced team environment.
  • Proficient English written and verbal communications skills required to collaborate effectively with internal and external teams.
  • This role will involve 20-40% travel to customer sites.

Benefits:

Starting from the interview process and continuing into your career with us, you will be working by our four Operating Principles:

  • Performance: High standards, outstanding results,
  • Impact: Big challenges, bigger results
  • Commitment: All in, every time
  • One team: One mission, shared success

Joining our team and company isn't just about expertise; it's about embracing uncertainty with ambition. We're crafting world-changing solutions, fueled by a passion to redefine what's possible. We will look for you to help create and shape the future of logistics solutions through our products, our culture and our shared vision.

You will also receive:

  • Medical
  • 401k
  • Share options

AAP/EEO Statement‚ÄØ

Dexory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. It prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

json.title: Software Engineer, New Grad & Junior
json.descriptionHtml:
At Jobright, we help high-growth startups hire top talent for their key roles.


About Us

[Jobright.ai](http://jobright.ai/) is an AI-driven job search assistant built to help professionals land their dream roles faster. Backed by a team of ex-Google, Twitter, and Microsoft engineers, and featured in the OpenAI GPT Store, we empower thousands of users daily through automation, resume tailoring, and insider job insights.


What You'll Do

As a new grad software engineer, you'll join our small but high-performing engineering team to build and scale the core infrastructure that powers our AI products. You'll work closely with senior engineers and the founding team on projects that ship fast and make a real impact.


You'll:

  • Build backend services and APIs for data ingestion, job matching, and user automation
  • Write Python code to process large-scale datasets (MongoDB, Snowflake, Zilliz)
  • Develop tools that automate and optimize workflows for job seekers
  • Collaborate on cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure) and CI/CD workflows
  • Analyze product usage and improve features based on user feedback and growth data


You Might Be a Good Fit If You‚Ä¶

  • Recently graduated with a CS, EE, Math, or related technical degree
  • Have solid Python skills and familiarity with SQL
  • Are excited about fast-paced startup environments and building from 0‚Üí1
  • Care deeply about user experience and product impact
  • Have some familiarity (or strong interest) in generative AI, cloud infra, or data pipelines
  • Bonus: Internship or project experience using MongoDB, Snowflake, or job-related platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Greenhouse)


Why Join Us

  • Work directly with a world-class team on a mission to democratize career success
  • Own meaningful projects from day one
  • Flexible hours, async culture, and remote-first
  • Fast growth: Jobright has grown 10x in the past year, with 40k+ daily users and viral reach on platforms like LinkedIn

json.title: Manager AI Platform Engineering
json.descriptionHtml:
Description

Introduction

Do you want to join an organization that invests in you as a Manager AI Platform Engineering? At Work from Home, you come first. HCA Healthcare has committed up to $300 million in programs to support our incredible team members over the course of three years.

Benefits

Work from Home, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

  • Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
  • Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
  • Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
  • 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
  • Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance.
  • Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
  • Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
  • Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
  • Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
  • Colleague recognition program
  • Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
  • Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income.

Learn more about Employee Benefits

Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.

You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients‚Äô lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Manager AI Platform Engineering like you to be a part of our team.


Job Summary and Qualifications

Leads the development and implementation of the AI Platform, actively contributing to technical development while building and leading a high-performing team of AI Platform Engineers to transform ML delivery, standardization, and adoption across the organization through development and delivery of a high leverage AI Platform.

Major Responsibilities:


  • Build and lead high-performing team of AI Platform Engineers, including hiring, coaching, and providing career development while fostering a culture of technical excellence and knowledge sharing.
  • Actively contribute to AI Platform development through hands-on coding and technical implementation, leading by example through direct contribution to critical platform components and infrastructure when possible while ensuring pod priorities and technical challenges are addressed.
  • Collaborate with AI Platform leadership to define technical standards and architectural patterns for AI platform, and engineering best practices.
  • Drive platform adoption and engineering best practices and standardization by partnering with tech leads and ML Engineering Leaders.
  • Collaborate with other engineering leaders to implement and maintain technical standards while aligning teams around technical decisions.
  • Conduct code reviews and participate in technical discussions to maintain high engineering standards and quality of platform usage and MLOps best practices across pods.
  • Lead technical discussions and architecture reviews to promote platform aligned solutions
  • Define and drive education and sharing sessions with embedded engineers and pod tech leads to drive adoption of platform and engineering standards.
  • Guide and contribute to development of foundational ML/AI capabilities including training pipelines, automation, and monitoring systems.
  • Champion ML platform capabilities partnering with Product and Tech Leads to identify and address barriers to platform adoption, ensuring consistent implementation of platform patterns.
  • Balance hands-on development with technical leadership and team management responsibilities to insure successful and consistent platform usage.
  • Collect and synthesize feedback from engineers and pod tech leads to inform platform priorities and roadmap based on pod needs.
  • Create opportunities for technical growth and skills development for team members.
  • Lead technical discussion and architecture review to promote platform-aligned solutions.


What qualifications you will need:


  • Bachelor's degree - Required
  • Master's degree - Preferred
  • 1+ year(s) of experience in a leadership role - Required
  • 7+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on AI Platform Engineering and AI Engineering or platform engineering - Preferred
  • Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience


Additional Requirements/Preferences:


  • Current hands-on coding abilities with recent experience in ML/AI systems or Platforms - Required
  • Strong technical background in Platform Engineering with demonstrated coding expertise - Required
  • Deep Python development expertise with a focus on ML systems or Platforms - Required
  • Strong understanding of Machine Learning workflows and operational requirements through direct implementation - Required
  • Hands on experience implementing and scaling model CI/CD and Continuous Training pipelines - Required
  • Hands on experience with major public clouds and delivering solutions leveraging their platforms - Required
  • Hands on experience with modern Python development practices including typing, linting, test frameworks, and package management - Required
  • Deep understanding of containerization and deployment of ML/AI models and systems - Required
  • Hands on experience creating developer tools and SDK and driving adoption by end users - Required
  • Strong background agile development within product teams - Required
  • Understanding of ML Development Lifecycle management and MLOps best practices particularly as it relates delivery of an AI Platform - Required
  • Experience managing team of product engineers - Required
  • Understanding of ML Monitoring and observability - Required
  • Experience with LLMs and Infrastructure - Preferred
  • Experience building and deploying feature stores and feature caches - Preferred
  • Deep understanding of ML/AI platform tooling and patterns - Preferred
  • Experience with Distributed model training - Preferred
  • Hands on experience with Kubeflow, Argo, MLFlow or other ML/AI Training orchestrators - Preferred
  • Hands on experience and knowledge of ML/AI metadata tools and model registries - Preferred
  • Deep hands-on experience with Terraform or other IaC tools - Preferred
  • Hands on experience building ML/AI solutions on GCP and Vertex AI ‚Äì Preferred


Work Location/Schedule:



  • Remote ‚Äì U.S. Only ‚Äì Sponsorship Not Available

json.companyDescription:
HCA Healthcare is dedicated to giving people a healthier tomorrow. 

As one of the nation‚Äôs leading providers of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare is comprised of 188 hospitals and 2,400+ sites of care in 20 states and the United Kingdom. In addition to hospitals, sites of care include surgery centers, freestanding ERs, urgent care centers, diagnostic and imaging centers, walk-in clinics and physician clinics.

Many things set HCA Healthcare apart from other healthcare organizations; however, at our core, our greatest strength is our people. Every day, more than 290,000 colleagues go to work with a collective focus: our patients. Our focus positively impacts the care experience at the bedside and beyond.

We are proud of the impact we have in our communities through employment, investment and charitable giving. 

HCA Healthcare is a learning health system that uses our approximately 37 million annual patient encounters to advance science, improve patient care and save lives. At HCA Healthcare, we are excited about the future of medicine. We believe we are uniquely positioned to play a leading role in the transformation of care.

Note: Be alert for fraudulent job postings, emails, and phone calls. HCA Healthcare will never send you money or ask you to send money during the interview or hiring process.

json.title: Junior Software Engineer - Test & DevOps
json.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Foodsmart is the leading telenutrition and foodcare solution, backed by a robust network of Registered Dietitians. Our platform is designed to foster healthier food choices, drive lasting behavior change, and deliver long-term health outcomes. Through our highly personalized, digital platform, we guide our 2.2 million members‚Äîincluding those in employer-sponsored health plans, regional and national Medicaid managed care organizations, Medicare Advantage plans, and commercial insurers‚Äîon a tailored journey to eating well while saving time and money.

Foodsmart seamlessly integrates dietary assessments and nutrition counseling with online food ordering and cost-effective meal planning for the entire family, optimizing ingredients both at home and on the go. We partner with national and regional retailers across the U.S., many of whom accept SNAP/EBT, making healthier food more accessible. Additionally, we assist members with SNAP enrollment and management, providing tangible access to nutritious food.In 2024, Foodsmart secured a $200 million investment from TPG‚Äôs Rise Fund, which supports entrepreneurs dedicated to achieving the United Nations‚Äô Sustainable Development Goals. This investment will help us expand our reach, particularly to low-income workers who are disproportionately affected by diet-related diseases.

At Foodsmart, Our Mission Is To Make Nutritious Food Accessible And Affordable For Everyone, Regardless Of Economic Status. We Are Committed To a Set Of Core Values That Shape Our Culture And Work Environment

Measured: We make data-driven, truth-seeking decisions.

Impactful: We are fueled by achieving our mission and vision.

Collaborative: We help each other be better and create a positive environment.

Hungry: We maintain a healthy growth mindset, seeking to overcome challenges with courage.

Joyful: We take joy in each other, our work, and the privilege of doing this work.

Whether you're a dietitian, a commercial leader, or a technologist, working at Foodsmart means being part of a team that is passionate, supportive, and driven by a shared purpose. Join us in transforming the way people access and enjoy healthy food.

About The Role

As a Junior Software Engineer (SWE), you will contribute to both our test automation and DevOps efforts. This hybrid role is ideal for someone eager to grow their skills in both software quality and infrastructure management. You will collaborate closely with our engineering, product, and DevOps teams to ensure that our applications are both reliable and performant across all environments.

You Will

  • Testing & Automation:
  • Collaborate with senior engineers to design and maintain automated test frameworks for web (React), mobile (iOS/Android), and backend ( Node.js/Java ) systems.
  • Develop and scale API tests integrated into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Execute end-to-end tests for workflows across microservices, data pipelines, and cloud environments.
  • Support the testing strategy for AI/ML models, ensuring reliability and performance.
  • DevOps & Infrastructure:
  • Assist with managing and maintaining cloud infrastructure (primarily AWS) and automated deployment pipelines.
  • Contribute to the automation of file transfer workflows, reducing manual intervention and improving efficiency.
  • Help monitor system alerts and troubleshoot issues related to system performance, connectivity, and security.
  • Assist in maintaining security protocols for infrastructure, including managing credentials and access controls.

You are

  • Detail-Oriented: You break down complex systems into testable components and are careful with managing infrastructure details.
  • Collaborative: You enjoy working with cross-functional teams and communicating effectively with internal and external partners.
  • Adaptable: You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and are excited to learn and grow in both testing and DevOps.
  • Security-Minded: You understand the importance of securing infrastructure and testing processes.

You have

  • A bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Basic experience with software development and testing frameworks (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, Cypress, etc.).
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS) and DevOps tools (e.g., Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Basic experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash, JavaScript).
  • Some exposure to CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure automation (Terraform, Ansible, etc.).

Nice To Have

  • Experience working with REST APIs and microservice architecture.
  • Understanding of cryptographic algorithms and security best practices in DevOps.
  • Knowledge of data validation techniques and working with cloud-based data tools (e.g., SQL, ETL).

$70,000 - $80,000 a year

Role: Junior Engineer

Location: Remote

Base Salary Range: $70,000/yr to $80,000/yr + equity + benefits

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries at our headquarters in San Francisco, California. Individual pay is determined by work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

About Our Benefits And Perks

Remote-First Company

Unlimited PTO

Flexible & remote location

Healthcare Coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision)

401k, bonus, & stock options

Registered Dietitian Sessions

Wellness reimbursement

Foodsmart is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other protected class.

json.title: Junior Consultant (Egypt, remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, Red Hat, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!

Job Summary

As part of the customer delivery team, a Junior Consultant at Red Hat is a technical person who supports the on-site delivery, implementation and adoption of Red Hat technology. These projects span various industries as we partner with customers to build enterprise IT solutions based on Red Hat platforms that are the trusted, consistent, and comprehensive foundation for any enterprise.

So, are you ready to launch your technical career with Red Hat? If so, we are looking for passionate individuals early in their technical career to help us unlock the world‚Äôs potential. Join us for a 12-month program journey, starting in September 2025.

What You Will Do

  • Learn all about Red Hat and how we support our customers to address their technical developmental and strategic business challenges with our portfolio and services
  • Build a strong support network of your Peers, Manager, Mentor and other Red Hatters within and outside of your customer projects
  • Develop technical skills in the Red Hat portfolio that span Cloud, Automation and AI solutions by completing training programs and attaining industry-recognized certifications
  • Apply your technical skills as you engage in meaningful customer projects, experiences and job shadowing opportunities
  • Enhance your professional capabilities through real-world experiences working directly with customers and participating in skill development opportunities
  • Focus on your personal and professional development as you grow your career at Red Hat

What You Will Bring

  • Passion and curiosity for open source technology and desire to build a career within the Tech industry
  • Strong technical skills in computer science, IT, AI, or related fields gained through university programs, upskilling bootcamps, certificate programs, military experience, etc.
  • Demonstrated experience applying technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills in an Enterprise IT-related project. Direct experience with Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform, and related technologies is preferred.
  • Willingness to travel customer sites depending on assignments and to work both in-person from a Red Hat office in Cairo and remotely
  • Effective communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively with internal teams and external customers
  • Full professional proficiency in written and spoken English and Arabic

Remember: You don‚Äôt need to have experience with every skill listed to join Red Hat! This role is part of a developmental program designed to help you grow and develop your skills. If you‚Äôre excited about this opportunity but feel you still have some learning to do, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe‚Äôre looking for passionate individuals eager to learn and grow with us!

About Red Hat

Red Hat (https://www.redhat.com/) is the world‚Äôs leading provider of enterprise open source (https://www.redhat.com/en/about/open-source) software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver high-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in-office, to office-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact.

Inclusion at Red Hat

Red Hat‚Äôs culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions that compose our global village.

Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO)

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, email application-assistance@redhat.com . General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.
